Thick, high quality material. Beautiful, bright colors in a wavy stripe pattern than really stands out. Fit is generous so consider sizing sown IF you're between sizes. I'm typically a size 6-8 and medium was roomy. At 5'9" length was fine for work. Arrived new with tags. Beautiful piece.

I loved this dress and wore it for a baby shower. I got lots of compliments on it, but it does run large. It's almost like an over-sized dress on purpose, but I like my dresses and clothes like that. If you are looking for something form fitting - this is not it. It was definitely a fun party/day dress!

The fabric is luxurious, heavy with a lovely drape. The pattern is vibrant, but the muted colors tame it somewhat. I "think" the shape is cute, but will need to try a much smaller size. I usually wear a 6, occasionally a 4. I got the medium, but will probably try an XS. The dress swallowed me. It's cute, but size down 1 if you want a generously oversized look, 2 sizes if you want draped-but-not-tented look.
It's really fun and the fabric is heavy, beautiful. I'm really busty and this dress didn't pull in any weird ways across the chest. Looks great with thigh high boots.
I loved wearing this on mew years eve! It's amazing quality! It fit large, I probably could've gone with a small but the medium was fine. I felt very cute and 70s
Heavy material, quirky colors but very comfortable. Great for someone who likes to stand out.

I can't get enough of this dress. It makes me feel effortlessly polished. The material is very high quality, and I love the color. It's 42 degrees in NYC so I paired this with tights and booties. Highly recommend.

I'd echo other reviewers in that in ran very large in terms of the volume of the dress but if you have broader shoulders, the M did fit in my shoulders. I'm between a M/L. Like a giant circus tent dress made of beautiful vibrant fabric and it was a blast to wear out. Not a dress to show off your figure but I did get compliments on it at a party!
I loved this dress! I wore it to work and received many complements. The sleeves were a little long but not too long that it was an issue.
Is VERY large, highly recommend sizing down. I am typically an 8 and got a medium, I should have gotten a small

LOVED WEARING THIS STYLE! I received so many compliments and will 100% be renting again. It was such a fun print and great way to add some color into my work wardrobe. Be sure to SIZE DOWN this style and most STINE GOYA dresses run large.
Wore this dress one size up at 32wks pregnant. So comfortable on my expanding body and loved the print.
I like this dress very much. yes, its s like a tent shape, but wear it with a cool boots (short ones without a big heel) and ... compliments non stop

links_reviews_title: Way too big but great quality - size way down
Cute tie did you can dress up or down
links_reviews_text: Cute and fun though a tad small

links_reviews_title: Loved this! Such an easy staple piece!
links_reviews_text: great fit, breathable fabric! got so many compliments!
Loved this for for vacation. I ordered a M based on some reviews and because I wanted to make sure it was loose and it's perfect. I typically wear a S or a 4.

Literally in love with this dress. I wore it on several dates, to work, and out with friends. I definitely got my use out of this dress for the month. It's great by itself or paired with a jean jacket. I love the bunching detail on the front, as I'm always self conscious with my middle section. Would recommend 1000x.
Throw it on and go anywhere. Would rent again

links_reviews_title: I rented this for everyday wear.
links_reviews_text: The dress is much more yellow than photos suggest. It almost looks like a ton of coffee stains all over the dress.
super cute comfortable and stylish! loved it will rent it again

This dress is cute and I need something to throw on for the weekend. The length is nice and the little twisty thing in the middle hides my belly nicely but it's just slightly too big. I think a M would have fit perfectly.

links_reviews_title: Very casual - knot doesn't lie flat
links_reviews_text: Rented this coping I could dress it up for work and get a weekend outfit out of it. It is definitely too casual for work. It's a thin cottony material and hits mid thigh on me (5'4). Could have worn it over the weekend but the knot doesn't lay flat and creates a pouch look at the bottom of the ribs. Sent it back without wearing
This dress fits absolutely perfect. I will absolutely be wearing it more than once.

Was reading the reviews and was shocked that someone said this dress ran well past their knees. The length was well Above my knees and I'm only 5'2. I found the knot in the front to create a little bulge and accentuated my middle. Was comfortable cotton though.
The dress fit well and had good shape. Cute for everyday

Super cute, fun dress! I wore with Converse sneakers. I'm 5'7 1/2" and typically a dress size 4; the medium hit mid-thigh (not too short by any means--a great length). The knotted center is very flattering! I really love this dress and will totally rent it again.
this dress is very cheap material and hangs like a bag.

links_reviews_title: Just got it for a cute summer dress.
links_reviews_text: It was way too long, hit be around the mid calf.

links_reviews_title: Nice colors, comfortable, but not as flattering as I would have thought
links_reviews_text: I loved how it looked in the model but I got a large and it felt pretty loose and made me look like a had a pouchy stomach. Maybe if I got a medium it would have been better. Nice colors and comfortable.
Super cute. Word with Hi-top Chucks and a denim jacket to see a show. It was great! Comfy while flattering and cute easy to "dress up" and down.

links_reviews_title: This top is a great basic for just about any outfit.
links_reviews_text: I styled it tucked into a red faux leather skirt (also from RTR) but could easily go with a pair of jeans or slacks. Super comfortable and fit exactly as I hoped. Only minor issue was that the neckline folded a bit in the front, but it didn't really make any difference.

I sized up and got a large bc I feel like theory usually runs so small but I think I would've been fine getting a medium. I still thought the large was fine, even though it was a little big. I just tucked it in to make it more fitted. Wore to work but could wear to anything

This was great for in between weather. The crochet pattern gives you a fall effect but the lightness and the cut still functions for warm weather. Oatmeal color, did not stretch out or snag. Not thrilling but definitely good

This shirt is very basic, making it versatile, and is cute. It's well made but does need a cami under. (You can see the color pop through on my pants) worked well to mix into my wardrobe for a short time
Lightweight, true to size
Fits well, just a little loose through the armpits.
I wore this for work. Our office space gets warm while in a conf room. It was terrific!
Loved this. I wore with high rise denim shorts on vacation and then wide leg white pants for work the next week.
Didn't wear. The xs was too tight in the arms and a little short. I usually wear an Xs or a S but I might rent again in a medium. Otherwise a nice top.

links_reviews_title: It was cute. I liked the color and texture of the fabric. It was in decent shape so no problem.
links_reviews_text: the pattern on the blouse gave it a nice detail. the color was a warm beige that went with everything.

links_reviews_title: Cute knit top for high waisted jeans
links_reviews_text: This is a great knit top for those days between summer and fall or spring and summer. I wore mine with a tank underneath because it could be a bit see through if not. It's also short so you would need higher waisted jeans or skirt (unless you're going for the crop top look).

Very high quality knit/crochet pattern in a nice color that was not too orangey-beige. You will want to wear a skin colored bra underneath but it doesn't need a camisole - not quite that see-through. The neckline edge of the scallops did flip around a little instead of lying flat but this did not bother me too much. Waist length on me at 5'4" wearing S.
I wore to work & to the airport. I wore a cream tank under it
Too big.

These were not my favorite overalls. They had no cute details or anything to make them feel special/girly, they just seem like something you'd wear to do yard work. They were short in the legs and tight in the hips with no stretch.

These are cute & you can tell the denim is high quality. Wish I would've ordered a size up. They were just a little snug around the hips, but I have full/wide hips so I don't think it's the fault of the brand or style! Consider sizing up for a wider hip. Wish they worked for me but sent them back the day after I got them without wearing.

These were the perfect weekend ensemble. Wore these to a farmers market, running errands on a Sunday and even to a fall wine festival! The straps are adjustable and comfy. I appreciated that it cinched in a little at the waist so it wasn't too boxy.
loved!
Rented overalls for the first time and I was pleasantly surprised!! A fun outfit and they fit well. Would rent again!

links_reviews_title: These are great and perfect for so many occasions or just out and about
links_reviews_text: No stretch but super well made and comfortable

links_reviews_title: New fave rental! Paired with frilly shirt to dress up, and I'm feeling myself.
links_reviews_text: I'm 5'9 and they hit just at/above ankle. Nice wide leg. Super comfy and casual. I usually wear a 4 in stretchy jeans and 6 in non stretch jeans... I went for the medium in these because the last pair CoH jeans I rented were slightly tight. Glad I did, these fit perfectly.

This is a great casual piece. The straps are adjustable and the waist fit well, even though I usually run into problems with the waist being too loose. This is a casual piece with a casual fit. There's nothing special about it, and if you want to show off body parts, this isn't for you. However, if you want a casual piece for a low-key day, it was cute and comfortable.

links_reviews_title: wish I could fit in it
links_reviews_text: it runs small making it look weird on, but on hanger looks cute

links_reviews_title: Fun to wear and play in
links_reviews_text: Tight around mid section - no stretch
Love these overalls, the fit the length, the comfort. Think I need a pair permanently in my wardrobe!

I almost returned this unworn because I didn't think I had the appropriate event... and then my partner bought tickets for Monster Jam. Couldn't have asked for a more perfect event! And he LOVED them! What man doesn't love a girl in overalls??? :)

~ if I had the money :-) They are the chillest overalls I've ever tried on. I love the wide leg (which actually isn't that wide, imo), because it just gives that easy-going, artsy look I was going for. Would possibly even size up next time for an even sloucher look. Wore with a sleeveless black turtleneck and leather sandals. I don't want to send these back!

links_reviews_title: Couldn't wear...too small in the hips.
links_reviews_text: Was too small in the hips for me which usually isn't a problem for me, size-wise.
They were tight in some places (like the waist) but really loose in others (pretty much everywhere else) and it was just weird. I haven't worn overalls in a while but these were not what I remember.
These overalls are so fun. I usually wear a 4 or a 6 and these were a little tight for me in the waist area.

links_reviews_title: Great Spring Dress and the color is beautiful!
links_reviews_text: I loved this cut of the dress. This size was slightly too big for me, next time size 6. I wore with a jean jacket one day for a casual look and a dress coat for work! Very cute and comfy
The material wasn't comfortable.

links_reviews_title: Wore this for a month straight
links_reviews_text: Super functional coat. Warm, huge hood and comfortable as heck! Live the side belted detail to elevate the look a bit
This jacket ran a little big. I own another jacket by this brand and this was much more oversized. It was so comfortable and so warm! I get compliments on it every single time I wear it. So obsessed!

Definitely meant to look long/oversized, but this jacket runs very large. I'm usually between a small/medium, but chose medium so I could wear sweaters under it... I think I could've fit 3 sweaters under it!!! Wish I'd gotten small or xs because it's actually very cute.

links_reviews_title: Interesting design, but the way the waist buttons closed causes the fabric to puff out a bit
links_reviews_text: I felt fashionable, but didn't think it was especially flattering. My husband was just confused.

I always have problem of pants being too long and need 25-25 inch inseam. This was the perfect full length pants hitting at the ankle for me. I wore with black slides, tucked in t shirt and leather jacket. Volume added interest. I didn't find it to be too wrinkly. My usual work pants size fit well.

links_reviews_title: Fit wonderfully but wrinkles easily. Had to iron twice in one day.
links_reviews_text: Fit wonderfully but wrinkles easily. Had to iron twice in one day.
I wasn't crazy about the material of this sweater...I wanted to love it but it seemed thick and itchy. I didn't end up wearing. I am generally a M/L in tops and this was a snug large.
True to size, nice thick fabric. Love the logo detail. The sweater was quite long, so it did ride up due to the tight, sweater martial. Great for a social distancing day out.
The fit is flattering, the material is lightweight and breathable but still has the weight to it like a nice sweater. Loved it.
The fabric is thick sweater and looks great on. I got an XS but needed a small. It fit a little snug
I loved wearing this statement sweater. Know that it does not stretch like other sweaters and if you are in between sizes I would size up.
Really enjoyed the 342 times I wore this sweater. It's nice and long and looks super over leggings. It is form fitting and easy to wear. I don't know why , but it made me feel super-cool. :)
Fits snug, a little long than a normal sweater
Went skiing with this shirt and stayed so warm while also looking trendy af. Loved it.
Comfy and chic, don't miss out!

Love this piece. I would have still ordered the same size but it was a very tight material. If you float between sizes, then I would size up. It's a cream color and my only complaint is where the material changes around the box outline, it can bunch a little. Overall though, I liked it

This is very well made. The logo is patchwork so it's not fragile at all and doesn't fade/stretch out. I'm a large but ordered a M and it worked because it supported my excess. It's fitted but in a good way and it was long enough too. I received many compliments too

Rented this for fall in NYC and it was perfect. Heavy knit, but not too hot. It was long and fitted, actually came past my crotch - unlike everything that's cropped and boxy these days! The sleeves were on the long side as well. It looked great with black jeans and the wool coat I rented here as well. Clean looking street style. Would rent again for sure.

links_reviews_title: What I was hoping it would be!
links_reviews_text: This is a win. It's thick material, a little tight in the hips, but a perfectly glam athleisure item for wearing just about anywhere. I got questions and compliments on this sweater most times I wore it. No complaints, will rent again next winter if it's still around! So cool.
A good combination of street smart and cozy/classy. Will definitely rent again. Pretty form fitting/not a lot of grace for lower stomach fat.

links_reviews_title: My Hubby & Teen Boys Loved It!
links_reviews_text: I'm busty and the logo area didn't have much stretch, so it was a little tight through the chest; otherwise, it fit great. Classy and casual. Will rent again.
I loved this sweater so much!!! Totally eye catching! Does hug the body all over so consider that when sizing. Loved it and received many compliments!

links_reviews_title: LOVE this sweater! I got so many compliments on my ski weekend :)
links_reviews_text: the fit if PERFECT if you are tall like myself. The body of the sweater was long on me and the sleeves were perfect. (I'm 5'10) If you are petite I wouldn't recommend renting this!

The fit of the sweater was slightly tighter than I had expected due to the stiffness of the ribbing. However it was still quite comfortable to wear. The fabric is thick enough to keep you warm and not bulky. I styled this for apres ski with a pair of Leather Spanx black leggings, velvet ankle boots, and a wide brim felt Ralph Lauren hat.
A little Long as far as sweaters go but looked awesome casual or more athletic as well as dressed up. Nice color nice fit

I love the fit, fabric weight, longer sleeves, logo patch...all of it!! This sweater was so iconic and memorable, that's the only reason I returned it, felt like I couldn't get away with wearing it too often. I could see renting it again though, I loved it. If you dont like sleeves that go past your wrist it may not be for you, but that's one of the things I loved about it.
I'm a 4-6 and these were true to size. Substantial fabric without being too heavy. Body and sleeves are long but I liked that. Tons of compliments. I highly recommend for a sporty, chic look.
This is meant to fit very snugly- not much leeway for mom bod.

links_reviews_title: Such a warm and current sweater...loved the color and fit
links_reviews_text: For me, the sleeves were a bit long as well as the length of the sweater-probably better on taller ladies, but I would purchase if the price is reduced
way too big
This sweater is comfy but it's really long. Looked awkward on me since I'm only 5'2
Ordered up so it would not be too clingy and loved it! Wish I could buy

I received compliments at work, at the bar, on the street ... all while wearing this sweater. It's so comfortable and chic. It's slightly long so I folded it into my jeans. I am obsessed with y3 and plan to buy this. Love love love!
This sweater is really well constructed and trendy. I got tons of compliments from people of all ages when I wore it. One of my students described it as "swaggy."
Cons: can be used as a layering, long enough if you have a long torso, light weight enough for you to wear during springtime or fall
I'm small on top, but the medium was perfect! Great for working from home.
It's an okay sweater.
Loved this sweater...gorgeous...thick, warm, wish I could've received the skirt to go with it!

This is a great sweater that is easy to dress up or dress down. It was comfortable and fit true to size, but it was very thick and warm. I’m almost always cold, and even for me it was a little too heavy.
Rented with the skirt. Great overall outfit and very, very warm. Almost too warm.
Runs a little small across the chest. I wear a 38D and it was snug. Otherwise it fit perfectly. If you're big busted you may want to size up

links_reviews_title: Glad I did a large, fitted but thicker
links_reviews_text: Honestly I am surprised this large is the largest this sweater comes in. I usually wear med/large so definitely did a large and glad I did. Super ice looks great, lots of compliments, neck was a tiny tiny itchy but worth it.

links_reviews_title: Warm and cozy- size up if busty.
links_reviews_text: Beautiful quality sweater that's nice and warm. Nothing too extraordinary in style, but it looks great with jeans. Wasn't able to order the skirt at the same time, so I wore it with dark wash jeans. Victoria Beckham always runs small for me, so I automatically ordered a medium. Fit me perfectly in a medium.
Great sweater! Love the design and fabric but unfortunately it runs quite small. I normally wear a medium but I'll need to try a large in this style. Will order again.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful sweater, looks better in person, loved the unique shoulder accent.
links_reviews_text: Loved this sweater, the navy was almost black, the olive trim was pretty, the seater fit beautifully & I received a lot of compliments. I would purchase this piece if it wasn’t so pricey. A definite repeat rental.
Cute with skirt or jeans! Nice heavy material, looks and feels high quality. Wore to work. V neck wasn't revealing and hook stayed closed all day.

links_reviews_title: Statement piece made for everyday life
links_reviews_text: The sweater has just the right amount of pizazz to be a statement piece but it's not too much for an everyday top. The hem line was shorter than I hoped but everything else was perfect. Just make sure you tuck the pointed shoulders inward when styling, or else it looks like a maleficent top.

links_reviews_title: This top was chic, easy and perfect for travel!
links_reviews_text: The fit is fantastic. I am petite so it was nice to wear something that fit well but was not to tight. It is a bit cropped so i recommend a high waisted denim.
Cute, comfortable sweater. The sleeves are a very nice touch but it is a bit cropped.

links_reviews_title: Loved a bit of fun on the sleeves to elevate your basic black sweater look.
links_reviews_text: I'd recommend sizing down - the fabric is amazingly warm and a bit thicker than expected so for a sleeker, slimmer, more flattering look, go one size smaller.
Loved this fit but ultimately didn't purchase because the puffy part of the shoulder kept moving around and it looked awkward by the end of the day.
Unfortunately, this top is too cropped for me and the snap at the v-neck is very awkward. Didn't wear :(

This does not look like it does online. The points on the shoulders stand vertical and it looks crazy. Would maybe look better on someone with a more broad frame, but if you are petite it is very weird.
I wore this to work and got tons of compliments. It's very comfortable but kind of low cut so you'll need a tank top if you're wearing it to work. Would rent again!
Nice black, white and pink tweed. Fit is a little too boxy for me.

Adds some interest to boring work blazers I typically purchase/wear. Pears with black and pink pants well. Also can be dressed down with jeans for the weekend. It's a very versatile blazer. It's pretty warm but I think can be worn in warmer times of the year. Will rent again for the spring time.
Wore this over a floral dress. Love how versatile tweed jackets are. The lapel doesn't stay down.

links_reviews_title: Great jacket! Cannot wait to rent it again!
links_reviews_text: I wore this for work and felt professional and polished but still felt unique in it. I could see wearing this with jeans on the weekend. It's perfect for winter but I will also want to wear it in the early spring when it's still chilly in NYC. I highly recommend this jacket (to my detriment because it will make it less available!). Love this jacket!

This jacket was very flattering! I received a ton of compliments and felt fabulous in it. The pop of color is just enough. The jacket was warm without being hot or heavy feeling. I would definitely rent again.

links_reviews_title: Boxy and tight fit around the shoulders and arms
links_reviews_text: I would recommend sizing up especially if you plan on wearing a long sleeve underneath it. Pink trim is bright. Ended up not wearing it due to the fit around my shoulders and arms. Also made me look boxy but that may have been due to the fit.
Many Compliments. Wore this a few times: work, everyday, weekend. With jeans and dark skirt
Super cute for a Monday work day!
Love this blazer, it's really fun but still 100% suitable for the office. Definitely runs larger as i think most RT items do

I absolutely love the look of this blazer. It's feminine but professional. I felt that it ran a bit small in the arms and shoulder areas. I would size up next time I order to be more comfortable. Other that that, I loved it!
Fit was great and got so many compliments on this jacket. Was perfect for work but would even wear out.

This sweater grew on me. The color is more oatmeal than white, which I didn't love, but after wearing to lunch with a friend I was hooked and wore it two more times. The back is super fun. It's soft and cozy. Great for weekends. I wouldn't wear for work with the open back though.

An easy, comfy sweater to throw on over black jeans. Style gives off a retro look so I went all the way with it pairing with gold hoops and adidas sneakers. Got compliments on how cute the outfit was for a sports bar outing. While I did like the sweater, I'm realizing that the cropped body look isn't the most flattering for me though, so I don't think I'll rent again. I think this would look great on someone taller with a longer torso.
I rented this for the Iowa holiday bowl game party and didn't realize until I got into sunlight that it's navy, not black - but luckily the game was at night so no one really noticed!
Preppy but fun with the cut in the back, sooo comfy but dresses up a little

links_reviews_title: LOVE this sweater and got ton of compliments.
links_reviews_text: The material is heavier but a good weight. Perfect for a fall mountain getaway! The split back was just enough to keep it fun and interesting but could still wear a bra! My favorite rental so far!
Good quality, heavy, true to size. I wanted medium but ordered large just in case. With this sweater I think I could have gone either way. Cute, perfect for fall.
Wore it, didn't love it. Runs big

links_reviews_title: Slam Dunk at the Cal Game
links_reviews_text: Wore this to the Cal Basketball game and on a casual Friday at work. Super cute, varsity look with a little spice in back. I wore a navy cami underneath. Sleeves are nice and long for a tall lady like me.

links_reviews_title: Go one size down... super comfy
links_reviews_text: Cute sweater that can be worn everyday. Slit in back is very classy. I usually get S tops but went with an XS for this one and feel great with the fit. Not tight at all

links_reviews_title: Comfortable and Easy, Like Pancakes on Sunday Morning
links_reviews_text: I LOVED this sweater. With a 32I bust, tops are hit or miss at RTR. This sweater was definitely a hit. Got so many compliments, and it was so easy to throw on over anything. Love the open back. Did not need a sweater underneath. Great quality. 100% would rent again (just did, actually). Fantastic quality.
Cute with high waisted jeans for a low key day with friends or family (with the semi open back)
It's big, cozy, and warm. I still can't decide if I liked the back detail but I got a lot of compliments.

links_reviews_title: I loved this sweater and got a lot of compliments. Great to throw with jeans for a casual look.
links_reviews_text: The fit was great. I'm short, and so are my arms! I always struggle with sleeves being way too long. This fit great. The slit in the back was a little bigger than I anticipated. Totally fine when you're upright; However, if I bent down, it realllllly opened up from the back. Whoops! Besides the occasional wardrobe malfunction, I really loved this and would probably rent again.
Definitely need a tank to wear underneath, but it was such a fun throw on sweater!
I got this to wear for my alma mater's Homecoming. Only disappointment was that the sleeves are navy and gold instead of black... great for Michigan fans! Perfect with high waisted jeans!

Wore this to a friend's birthday get together on a fall day and didn't need to wear a jacket over. Love the 100% cotton material and the back design. Got lots of compliments. Have rented many pieces from 525 America and consistently love them

links_reviews_title: This is a great every day sweater. It was perfect for a casual outdoor fall weekend.
links_reviews_text: True to size. More of a boxy fit. Loved the how it opened in the back. Warm and comfy material.
Great casual sweater with a fun back detail. Runs large in my opinion

This was basically an accidental last minute order. I picked it because I needed something in a rush. Now I'm considering buying it. The fit is oversized & slightly cropped. It definitely requires high waisted pants. The back vent is tall enough to be conservative sexy without showing my bra. I wouldn't wear it to work or church, but I would wear it pretty much anywhere else. Also, most importantly, it's not itchy. I've never heard of this brand but they have a lot of similarly styles sweaters & I am a fan.
Loved this top wore it dressed up with heels and wore it every day with sneakers. Loved it!
It is way way way to wide. Otherwise great. Size down for sure. I liked the neutral colors
This fit well in a relaxed way and was comfortable- not too heavy or itchy like some sweaters. I like the trendy pattern and greys and wore it to work with black pants. Great for casual occasions.

links_reviews_title: Cute sweater to get engaged in!
links_reviews_text: I wore this when my bf proposed. It's a great top however it runs a tad small. I'm normally a medium and the shoulders were a tad narrow even in the large! But it was a really cute sweater.
I love this sweater. I wore it over 8 times to work and to dinner. I love the look of the sweater paired with gray jeans and black boots.

links_reviews_title: Warm sweater that can be dressed up or down
links_reviews_text: Loved the print and quality of this sweater!
If your in between sizes size down. Also it is a super thick heavy sweater material so make sure you have the weather for it.

links_reviews_title: So comfortable and cute. Your every day sweater.
links_reviews_text: Looks adorable with the front tucked into a pair of jeans. So comfortable and cozy, would definitely recommend for anyone looking for an every day sweater.
Well made, gorgeous sweater ... bulky but still short and not oversized

links_reviews_title: Winter wonderland, Scandinavian design wool sweater
links_reviews_text: Comfy, very warm wool sweater. Unique Scandinavian pattern that runs from front to back. Great for cold weather layering.
Great color and lots of compliments.
Wore this for apres and lounging at home. It was well made, warm and comfy enough, and perfect for a ski weekend, but wish it were a bit more cozy.
I love that this piece can be unisex. I sized up since I have broader shoulders but had plenty of room. I love the detailing on the neckline. This sweater is a good piece to spice up any look.

links_reviews_title: Great winter staple or can be used for skiing (whether you're a bunny or a double-diamond)
links_reviews_text: Perfectly over-sized. I enjoyed the style, but if you want a more fitted look, would suggest a size down.
This sweater was thick, warm--and flattering for this sweater style. Great for cold winter days.

links_reviews_title: Perfect cocktail dress for a work event!
links_reviews_text: I love this blazer dress so much! I wore it to a work dinner and received a lot of compliments. It's very comfortable and roomy.
One of my fav rentals! The asymmetrical and zipper contrast are on point. Rent this one!!
Tried an XL based on experience with this brand and then an L. Wore the L but next time I'll try an M. Cute though!
Loved the idea of this dress, but it didn't look good on me. Shoulders too boxy? Awkward proportions, anyway. Too bad.

links_reviews_title: Way to big. I'm a Small but definitely needed XS
links_reviews_text: TOO BIG but really cute. Order a size down and you'll be fine.
I loved it on the hanger, but it was too big on me. The sleeves were too long, neckline too deep, and body too boxy. I may try a smaller size.

links_reviews_title: This is such a hip dress!
links_reviews_text: I loved this dress so much! I wore it to work paired with black boots. So many compliments!! I wore a large and I still felt like I could go down a size. I'm a 30 waist,38D,5'7" did not fee super big on me. Very comfortable!! I will rent this again!

So I didn't end up wearing this as I found it extremely large. I'm 5'6", 145 lbs, straight and athletic build and I was swimming in the medium. I would have to reorder in a size small, maybe even XS. Too bad as I planned on wearing it NYFW for work.
The fit on this was a little weird. I more hourglass shaped so it was too big in the chest, didn't lay right at all, and a little snug in the thighs. It was an interesting piece though.
Loved this blazer dress. So sad didn't get to wear since it ran large on me. Will def rent a size down next time.

links_reviews_title: Love this dress, but you need to wear a slip.
links_reviews_text: So many compliments. It's definitely bulky/straight and as such hides your figure but does so in a man-tailored stylish way. I loved that I could unzip from the bottom a tad to give some sex-appeal!

I got this in a large and it was a little big so it felt more like I was wearing a jacket than a jacket dress....I wonder if the medium would have made the look better. It's cute - super different than what I typically wear but that's what I love about RTR - u put can try different looks. I will maybe try this again in a smaller size.

links_reviews_title: So great and so many compliments!
links_reviews_text: I rented a size large. I am 5'3" and about 160lbs with an athletic build, and it was a really comfortable fit. The sleeves were a tiny bit long, bu that was really it. I got lots of compliments at the party we went to. It was a 50th birthday party at a country club and multiple other guests came up and asked me where my dress came from.

I rented a size Medium. I am always a medium in clothes, this ran very big. Tried it on, didn't even touch/hug my body and was low cut. I couldn't make it work. Very nice quality though. Could possibly work if I had gotten a size smaller.

links_reviews_title: Loved it. Got compliments on the look and style.
links_reviews_text: The fit was slightly too big at the top, but fit perfect everywhere else.
The photos are deceptive. Even if you are tall, the dress is still too big.

links_reviews_title: Not for petite women but a nice piece and unique construction!
links_reviews_text: I rented a size small and it was HUGE! Definitely not for petite women. However, it is very cute and well made just not for me.

I love the uniqueness of this dress. Because I am only 5'1" I was able to get away wearing this in a professional work environment. The front hem was knee length on me. I had to wear a black knit top underneath because the top front lacks a secure closure. I wore this dress with black hosiery and black suede pumps. The options to change the look of this dress are endless.
Runs very large. A style that was fun to wear but not something I would purchase. Fabric is heavy. Great for fall/winter

Gorgeous dress - but I was absolutely swimming in it. I ordered an XS because the sizing said it runs large, and it still was way too big (and not in an intentional way). Just wasn't right for me and I'm super bummed because this dress is fire!!

Solid construction, fabric is thick and the zipper detailing is way cool. Arms were a tad bit long which was fine, but the torso area was rather large (but shoulders and waist/bottom fit right). The dress does flop open at the top; I did not want to wear an undershirt or camisole so I opted to just pop the collar and wear the dress flush against my body, instead of blazer style as it was too low cut that way. Very comfortable with tights and boots for winter.
Wish it fit, just too big.

I had a hard time styling this and deciding what to wear it to, but it worked for a night out with friends. At 7.5 months pregnant, I sized up and definitely didn't need to. It was plenty roomy and the v neck is low. But the fabric is thick, great for fall, and made me feel really great while wearing it.
I sized up, but shouldn't have. I didn't get to wear it because it was too big. Very good construction, though.

I'm a 4/6, pear shape. I definitely cannot wear it as a dress, as it's too tight around the butt, so I wore it as a jacket, which is cool especially the red zipper on the shoulder. And it's also tight around arms, so I really couldnt comfortable wear a long sleeves inside. So it's great for fall outfit!
Absolutely gorgeous and the quality is amazing, but SIZE DOWN! I'm a 4 and rented the small. I swam in this. I will definitely rent a again in an XS!
Sexy enough since it's short in front. Found it to be very chic and cool. Will rent again! Easy to wear and versatile
Fits chill, goes great with combat boots or dress up for work and heels. Very versatile between work and personal. I used a small pin to not show too much cleavage throughout the day.
Gorgeous dress. Draped beautifully. Very chic. Would buy if I could.

Ignore the old, worn mirror- I still wanted to share the photo bc I really loved this dress! I will rent again- but may size down. A perfect work dress. Comfy and classy. I agree with other reviewers who said it's more navy.

The dress has a wraparound robe kind of structure and is well constructed. The collar, sleeve, and waist are like a button-down dress shirt and creates a subtle look of formality. The neckline cuts low enough and the dress part reveals enough leg that I felt like I needed to wear something underneath that I didn't mind showing. When walking the wrap dress part slit open to my upper inner thighs.

This Rag & Bone dress has a very chic vibe with the low neckline & draped drop-waist. My husband thought it was both sophisticated & subtly sexy. It was just ok on me but would look much better on someone at least 5’6”. If the waist had been just a little higher it would have draped properly. Better for a “Straight & Narrow” frame as it’s cut slimmer in the hips.

Saw someone else note that they just wore this as a coat over an outfit. I don't do very well with the V neck dresses and this was no different. Would have gone to work showing my bra. LOVED it as a coat. May keep...
the dress was a little baggy up top, but it was super cute on and sexy in a understated type of way but still appropriate for work. i got a lot of compliments on it as well!
I really liked the drape and shape of this one. It is a bit low cut- used a safety pin. Will probably wear again before returning.
While snug across my waist, there was plenty of room in the chest and hips. I liked that I could layer underneath for warmth and that it has pockets. Keeping this for a few wears!

links_reviews_title: Cute! A bit big for wrote girls
links_reviews_text: This was cute but needed a belt to cinch it and rush it was a bit shorter. Really interesting waffle-like fabric. Great got work!

This was...just kind of a black dress? It was a little frumpy and not anything special. Fine for one day at work but not memorable. Fit was big on top - I had to keep it closed with a safety pin to keep it work appropriate - and I sized down per reviews. I have pretty big hips and it was a little snug on my hips with a size down, but only a little. I would not recommend sizing up under any circumstance.

links_reviews_title: This slouchy dress is so chic
links_reviews_text: Obsessed. Wish I could buy. I love the oversized fit and the material.
The dress fit me weirdly. The torso seemed too long so it bunched weirdly at the top, and the midi length was super unflattering. No good.
Lighter weight than I expected, so returned, but would consider re-renting in Fall
Material was a disappointment. Front clasp/area droops awkwardly in the bust area. I'm 34B, and it was very loose.
1. the dress come in wrinkled. 2. sleeve is bit tight; however, runs large at the bottom I did not wear, return right away
Beautifully tailored, elegant, commands attention. Fits like you are wearing a well-fitting skirt suit.
I would have purchased this dress if the fit was better. I wore it once and loved it. But I had to pin it and tape it down . It was too loose.
Well fitting. Sleeves long, which was great for someone tall like me. Very flattering cut

I wore this to a dress rehearsal/cocktail party for a wedding and absolutely loved it! This could be easily dressed up more to wear to a wedding or any sort of semi-formal event. It may be too much for work, but if you're doing an important presentation or event, you could certainly pull it off. The opening in the front may have to be manipulated (pinned close) a bit unless you were a statement camisole or bra beneath and do not mind it looking more like a drapey-v neck dress. I got loads of compliments and felt very confident walking around in this dress!

links_reviews_title: Great concept, constant adjustments of dress.
links_reviews_text: The dress is navy not black. The fit was okay. The interior button placement made the waist really tight and I wish the chest area had a hook or snap so it would not open every time I moved. Received several compliments, but didn't think it was functional.
Loved the look. Wore for a holiday party for my industry. Elegant and work appropriate while also stylish. Would rent again, next time in smaller size.

I'm 6'1 and this hit right below my kneecap. It's a wrap dress with buttons vs tie. Super good fit. Watch out for strong breezes. And everyone who saw me told me how professional I looked, which might be more a commentary on the clothes I normally wear vs the dress itself.

links_reviews_title: A nice cut, good material, runs really large.
links_reviews_text: Would have been a great "sort of edgy but still appropriate" work dress but it was huge on me. Will try again in a smaller size.

links_reviews_title: Too much material for a petite person.
links_reviews_text: Waist fit but then top was too blousy.
Perfect fit. Wore to work when I had a leadership meeting. Might be a little revealing in chest so I wore a camisole underneath! Perfect!
Such potential, but alas the dress runs large and I am just a bit too short for it to fit properly at the waist
Easy to wear and comfortable
Runs big
Dress was missing a button so was unwearable and the chest area was so baggy you would have to wear a cami under
chest opening falls really low, suggest wearing an undershirt, but with that, its very chic and the material is cool, not your average texture-less plain black
When it fits better it doesn't look dumpy like it does on the model

links_reviews_title: This dress had so much possibility...but way too big to even wear
links_reviews_text: Great fabric and texture and lots of possibility to be a great work dress, but just way too big in the waist and chest so it sagged. Probably would work on a more apple body...
Gorgeous, easy to wear, sexy but in an understated way. Lovely crepe fabric. Did wrinkle a little, but not so much that it looked bad. More navy than it appears in the photos.

This was fine for work but it was so baggy on top that I had to use a safety pin to make it suitable for work. I run between a 4 and 6 and wore the small. I also have a small chest. I easily could have worn the extra small.

links_reviews_title: Best fit for someone long in the torso.
links_reviews_text: Fabric felt expensive.

Runs a bit large I think, even for a baggy look. I'll probably reorder but try a medium the next time. More exciting that a typical black wrap dress as the fabric has some texture to it and the front drapes interestingly. Definitely midi length.
I wore this unbutton over jeans and a top and I LOVED it! So many compliments. The length gave an elegant look to my everyday outfit.
I was excited about this dress but it sort of disappointed me. Will order it again when the weather cools down and also size down

I really enjoyed this piece. It's really is a unique take on the classic black blazer. The only thing was that it had some serious pilling and desperately needed a fabric shaver taken to it. Aside from that, huge fan. Would have bought it if it was just a little lower.

links_reviews_title: I kept this and wore it everywhere for a week. Great for transitional weather
links_reviews_text: Nice leather detail around the collar. No buttons to close it, so this is not a jacket for real winter, more a spring or fall piece
Looks great and very warm for cold weather. Worn to work and church.

This jacket is awesome. It is very transitional and can be worn to work and with jeans. It is kind of a heavy knit sweater type material with leather trim. The leather trim is not too edgy. Nicely tailored and very appropriate. I will rent again.

This blazer was a great piece for any work rotation! It instantly elevated any outfit that you wore it with. Love the leather detailing on the inside trim. Fabric had a slight stretch to it so fit the shoulders nicely. Love this blazer!

Is this an RTR exclusive? I am obsessed with this jacket. It is my favorite rental so far. I've already worn it twice in the two weeks I've had it. I would buy it, but the RTR MSRP seems artificially high (higher than the old style which had a leather belt) and I can't find it in stores I wore this to work for client meetings over the Theory Power Dress. So professional with just a touch of edginess from the leather trim True to size. I wear a 2 or 4 depending on the brand. Am almost always a 36 in IRO

A little too warm for an 80 degree day, but I had to snatch this beauty up when it first became available. I plan to hold on to this quality piece until the weather is right. It is super thick wool material with beautiful leather accents; unlined with slight shoulder pads and longer arms. So nice and perfect for fall.
Would definitely rent again!

I have broad shoulders, and this jacket has tiny shoulder pads. I should have sized up because it just didn't fall on my shoulders right. If it had, I would have worn this many more times! Gorgeous fabric and detailing, too.

links_reviews_title: Don't want to send it back!
links_reviews_text: Fits perfectly. So chic and comfortable. At the end of my second week and think I may keep it for a third. Wore to lunch with an old friend, into NYC for a show, to an interview. So versatile. One of my best rentals so far.

links_reviews_title: such a cute and warm jacket
links_reviews_text: fit smaller on the arms but still worked
Really nice fitting - not baggy but not too tight. A great addition to a work outfit.
Heavy fabric that fell nicely

links_reviews_title: I have broad shoulders and long arms and this was shockingly flattering
links_reviews_text: The fot was perfect classy and fun. Semi fitted. I went with a size 40 I think and im usually a 10
I rented this for work, but also wore with leather leggings over a long tunic for a more polished weekend look. Warm and great quality.
This is a bit bulky and the material is heavy. I also did not like the way it felt against my arms while I was wearing a sleeveless dress. It looks nice though.

links_reviews_title: Awesome w jeans & booties! Loved it!
links_reviews_text: I had to travel last minute for business so grabbed this out of my bag and was so glad I had it! Wore it w jeans and booties out then with a fitted skirt for business. Such a great piece! Highly recommend!
Simple but beautiful that I could wear with a lot of things in my wardrobe to office.
Loved it, but it was not the right season--will re-rent in Fall. Beautiful jacket but not for late August in DC/NYC.
Love this jacket. Fits well and perfect for work with dress or sleeveless blouse
It was way too heavy for summer attire. I found the material to be more suitable for winter. The length of the arms were too long for my petite frame.
This was one of my favorite rentals. It is a great staple and I got tons of compliments on it.
Comfy crop top sweater. Paired well with high rise jeans. Nice and warm as well

One of those classic sweaters I can see being really handy for every day situations or you don’t really want to try too hard. Felt more on the short side, but not cropped. Thicker material, so prob not great for spring, better for fall/winter. Def considering purchasing.

links_reviews_title: Cute scultped sweater, sleeves are a little long
links_reviews_text: I like the way this fit. It's slightly cropped for work, so I was glad the pants are high waisted. The sleeves are a little long, but I know that some people like that look and feel. These pants are also from RTR!
Really cute yet understated sweater; sleeves were a little too long for me
So comfy! Would have gotten a medium for a looser fit on torso. Loose fit on arms though which I like

Yes its short, i am not big fan of it, would be great over summer flower dress ( for that fashion look), I didn't had right one. But its not itchy at all -100% merino wool, soft & keep body warm ( but not like uncomfortably hot as synthetic can be )

links_reviews_title: Short in the waist, nice wool
links_reviews_text: Shorter than expected. Well made and comfortable to wear all day
Need very high waist pants, runs small and staticky and slightly itchy. Did not wear
It's definitely somewhat cropped which I expected based on the pictures. The sleeve detail is cute and makes this a special sweater. Definitely recommend.

Only wore it twice but it was a nice addition to the closet. I knew the arms wouldn't be too long on me because I'm tall and if anything I have the opposite problem. I sized down based on some of the reviews and I'm happy I did, this sweater is pretty thick and bulky so I wore it on warmer days since a jacket wouldn't easily fit over the structured sleeves.
Nice material and beautifully made. I received a brand new one with the tags and now wish I purchased it.

links_reviews_title: didn't get to wear because the weather changed
links_reviews_text: cute
This sweater was super comfortable and chic! Looked great with jeans and I felt great all day. I would recommend this even for the busty girls. I am a 36DD and it was incredibly flattering.
This was a fine sweater. Sleeves are structured and bow out
Cute idea but crop didn't work for me and was overall nothing special.
Beautiful material and style. Loved this sweater as a staple for work and client meetings.

links_reviews_title: Pretty but too small to wear.
links_reviews_text: Pretty but the small is really more like an XXS.
Because it is slightly cropped, this will work well with high-waisted work pants. Soft and cozy, and the bubble sleeves are not over-the-top
I'm literally obsessed with this sweater. It was SO cute with high waisted jeans and mules. I wore this for dinner and a night out.
Cute and warm but VERY cropped. I wore with high waist jeans and it was fine for date night, but I couldn't have worn it to work (I'm 5'4''; 120ish). Would not rent again or buy.

I liked this better than other shirt sweaters with big sleeves. The sleeves weren't too over powering. Looked good with high rise pants. My husband hated it though and said it looked horrible. Not his style I guess!

I went up a size and I'm glad that I did. I think the XS would have been too short in the waist. The sleeves make it interesting, but are not overwhelming- even for someone with a small frame. Very glad that I took a chance on this one!

The fabric was very comfortable and soft - could be worn without undershirt. The overall appearance was nice and hugged all the right places. My only complaint is that I wish the sweater was one inch longer in the torso - I have a longer trunk than most. Even with the highest waisted jeans I owned, but stomach was always out an awkward 1/2 inch.

Was hoping to have more drama and shape in the sleeves, but overall this was a reliable sweater. Fits true to size (perhaps on the smaller side) and is warm and very comfortable. A bit cropped, heads up!

this is the best sweater that ever happened to me. fair warning, i have the world's shortest torso so this fit nicely, it would be a crop top on most people. I would size up if you want a looser fit bc it is tight. It felt like a cashmere hug and looked fabulous tho.
a little short so wear with high waisted pants
thick material, great neutral. looks great with higher waisted pants because short torso. midly puffy sleeves are a nice twist
Cute and soft. Puffed sleeves add subtle style.

links_reviews_title: Oh so wonderful sweater. very flattering and comfortable.
links_reviews_text: loose arms, runs till belly button area and very warm
Loved this cozy sweater! It was cropped so I had to wear with high waisted pants.

links_reviews_title: fun, and different, but still in my fave color.
links_reviews_text: I loved the puffy sleeves and cropped look.
This is a cropped sweater so you would have to wear something underneath if you were to wear this in the wintertime. Good quality otherwise.

I ordered the xs because other reviews say it is oversized but I usually wear a 4 (always size small) and sometimes a 2 and this was too small on me. either it runs true to size or the sweater I got was shrunken.

My best friend and roommate sees what I wear every single day of my life and said this sweater was the most flattering thing I've ever worn. So, yeah, big fan! It is SUPER thick and warm though so make sure you're wearing it on a cold day otherwise it's a bit uncomfy

links_reviews_title: shed a lot of fuzz everywhere...
links_reviews_text: It was definitely oversized but still kind of cute, it would be hard to go down a size though because it was pretty cropped. Also, got fuzz balls everywhere so that was kind of annoying.
Love this sweater! Wore is multiple time the weekend I rented it. The oversized sleeves and higher neckline are just perfect. Super comfy and warm! Great weekend staple.
You'd have to be in the WNBA for these pants to fit in length. I had in 3-4 inch heels and they were still 4+ inches too long!
Fits perfectly for my body shape. I'm skinny with small curves. Wide leg doesn't swallow my small frame. Everyone likes them. I'm 5'4 and HAVE to wear heels.
High waisted (perfect to tuck in blouse), amazing fit. Great lined fabric. Did stretch out a little after a 12 hour day, but still fit great.

links_reviews_title: Meh, not for people with hips/thighs/butt
links_reviews_text: I have always wanted to wear wide leg, but given that I have wide hips and thighs/butt, they have never fit wide on me. The pant legs themselves do fit wide and the waistband is fine, but the crotch is very uncomfortable when sitting. Also, the general silhouette looks better on someone with a smaller waist - this makes me look one width from top to bottom. This is a pass for me - definitely order a size up.

The quality and construction of this piece is perfect. I wore it for a night out so I wore a nude deep v bodysuit but would certainly wear this again multiple ways. With a higher neck body suit for work. Rent both pieces and then wear the duster with different pants and then wear the pants with a different top. I'm 5'6 26/27 pants 34c 130lbs

These pants exceeded expectations. They're very high waisted and hug all the right spots. I'm normally a 2 or 4 in work slacks and the Small fit perfectly. Definitely needed to wear heels with them since they were long. Flattering all around.
Great for cold weather, very comfy and fits like a glove , great fit for a curvy girl

links_reviews_title: The perfect pants from day to night!
links_reviews_text: Would 10/10 recommend! such a fun shape and structured enough to wear at the office but comfortable enough to wear on a night out! Great quality but recommend going up a size because they run a bit snug

This bugged my body perfectly and fit like a glove. I am curvy so it's hard to find pants that fit at the hips and aren't too big at the waist but these were perfect. So in love with this suit. Definitely rent with the blazer. Will definitely get again!

links_reviews_title: Great fitting pants, very business like
links_reviews_text: Wore these to work. Would definitely keep these in my closet for a while as these can be worn dressed up for work or dressed down for casual event. They are a thick material so they don't get too wrinkled and are warm for the winter. I am always concerned about these type of pants fitting too tight in the hips but they are true to size and flattering
A little tight through the hips
Pants were way too small.
I normally wouldn't pick an XS. It was the recommended size and was too tight in the waist. For my body type a S would be better.

links_reviews_title: I had to wear something else.
links_reviews_text: I was unable to wear these. The XL did not fit, and I normally wear a L.
Runs very small. Could fit on but not flattering. I like the cut so may try one size up next time
Slightly too sexy for work. Fits my curves a little too well. Too kardashian-y for me, especially for a wool trouser.
The XS was too small and the S was too big. Disappointing that I have these pants two tries.
Really loved these pants. It was a bit tight in the waist, but fit my legs and thighs very well. I will rent again. Great length for my height (5'10").
Nice material. Very flattering fit. A bit high-waisted for me and the waist ran a bit small.

links_reviews_title: Runs small through hips and legs.
links_reviews_text: Although I wasn't able to wear these amazing pants -- I gave them five stars because the people they will for -- they will be your favorite!!! I wear 6 in just about everything. The mediums were way too tight in the hips and thighs to even try to zip. It felt like I was trying on clothes in the juniors department. So sad. These had the potential to be a staple in my wardrobe.

links_reviews_title: Not applicable, unable to wear the item.
links_reviews_text: From the time I removed the item from the garment bag, I knew something was wrong by the way the pants looked on the hanger. These pants had been altered incorrectly, so the pleats don't match and you can not put your leg through the pant leg. I was unable to even try them on because of the way they were sewn.

This shirt was shorter than expected and the keyhole was a lot lower cut. I Also was not expecting the waist to be so cinched. I am somewhat flat chested and the way the shirt was made was not flattering on my body type at all. I was looking forward to renting this and didn't even up wearing it.

links_reviews_title: So cute! A little short for y'all people- wear high waisted bottoms!
links_reviews_text: Light-weight beautiful blouse! I got tons of compliments. You can open the blouse up more to be a v neck if you wish. I'm 5'9" and it was a little short on me but was fine with high waisted jeans!

The fabric was very light and breathable. The sleeves had a great frill detail. Being taller (5'9") I was concerned about the peplum style but it fit perfect and hit my natural waist at the right spot. It is paired with the AG high waisted skinny ankle denim that I rented from RTR.
Very cute, easy to wear top. Material is light and a fun pattern. Would definitely rent again.

I rented this specifically for work, but ended up wearing it to meetings. I dressed the blouse down with ripped jeans, chelsea boots, and a black vest. I am planning on wearing this top again with dress pants and slip on loafers. Didn't love this top, but the fit is flattering. Probably wouldn't rent again as I want to try other tops.
Super cute top. It is fairly low cut. I am typically between a S & M and wore the S in this and it still ran large. Size down.
A fun print, sexy neckline and comfortable fabric made date night easy
This fits so great and is fun for work. I am going to wear it again this weekend with jeans.
Wore this for work & then our after. Fits true to size. Love that the waistline shows your shape. Super flattering and very fun pattern!

I'm always an XL/XXL so i ordered up just to be safe (because i have a problem with RTR clothes somehow being smaller even though it's my normal size) and it was STILL way too small to wear. Such a shame, it looked so cute on the model.
Cute and comfortable

Shirt shorter in bodice than I realized. Cinched me below waist and then fell above top of high rise Jean's. Be aware, the material behind the buttons is super "floppy" and therefore constantly folds back. This causes a gap between buttons allowing your bra to show through. Due to fabric, a pin or fabric tape would not work. My bra was clearly on display the whole time. Note: I am large chested. I didnt mind the reveal, but depends on where you are going.

This surprised me because it's not silk or even polyester. It's a tried and true cotton - so it feels a bit more casual. Wore with black jeans and a draped black jacket for dinner. Overall cute and sizing was true
Loved this! Wore it to work so I tied it up to make it into more of a high neck blouse. Material felt great and the cut and pattern was fun and flirty. I got lots of compliments!

links_reviews_title: Pink is brighter than it looks online.
links_reviews_text: Runs a bit large. Colors were a bit too bright for me.

links_reviews_title: Such a cute, comfortable top perfect for so many different occasions!
links_reviews_text: Rented this for a work trip and wound up wearing multiple times - meetings, a network event and lunch date with friends. Super comfortable and flattering top that was easy to dress up or down. Only issue was gaping in the chest area - the shirt has a little flap designed to cover that gap but it's such a thin, light material that it doesn't actually stay in place. I wound up pinning it at the top so I wasn't flashing everyone.
This shirt is so cute and chic! True to size!!! I should buy this one!
I loved this jacket so much I ended up buying it! The blue tones in the jacket are beautiful, even more so in the sunlight.
The look is beautiful but there isn't a liner and the wool is very itchy on the arms. Make sure you wear a long sleeve with this jacket.

links_reviews_title: This jacket is really thick, warm and doesn't have a lining so the sleeves are itchy.
links_reviews_text: Fit as expected.
Very cute but so itchy that I'm sending it back after one wear. It's itchy even through a long-sleeved shirt. I normally wear M/L and a S fit well.
Very pretty, more blue in person. Great fit.

This is not a jacket, but more of a coat. Very good quality fabric, but not lined. Ended up wearing it as an outer layer unbuttoned, with jeans and boots. I got it thinking I could have worn it to work.
Nice looking blazer, however I sent it back because the material irritated my skin so much I couldnt see myself wearing it
Very cute with T-shirt and jeans. This jacket is a nice way to elevate an everyday look.
Go a size down.
Still had the new tags when I got - was nice for work and for well. The sleeves were just a touch too long which is a problem I frequently have- but looked nice.

links_reviews_title: More of a jacket than a blazer
links_reviews_text: Very heavy, but great for the colder months. Wear something long sleeve underneath as the fabric is a little scratchy

Received new with tag. Always a delight! The fit is boxy and runs large. It is not lined and it's very scratchy. Paired with a black cami and it is shedding onto it. On the positive side, I love the shades of blue. Definitely wear it with long sleeves underneath.
A clever pea coat like this can pull any outfit together. Perfect for the end of winter when you are craving spring & lighter colors (tan and ivory). Nicely tailored.
Perfect for my spring trip in London. It was about 40-55° F and I was never cold. So flattering and cute
This coat fits amazingly well and is still in great shape. The fabric has good weight, luster and depth. The colors are very complimentary and rich. Elegant. It will be with me for a while. Love RTR.
It was recommended to size up in this style but I found it to be more oversized/the sleeves were a little long. It's warm and was great to wear everyday and can be easily dressed up or down!

I wore this one day when I was in downtown Chicago and it was perfectly comfortable and warm. It was so cute and I felt great in it. It was definitely a little more fitting in the hip and waist area, but that didn't bother me. As a tall girl, it was a tad short in my arms (most coats are) but it wasn't super noticeable. I would wear this again.
I love this coat! From the pattern to the color to the fit (it's slightly oversized). I'm keeping this through winter :-)

Luckily I rented this coat before a freak cold snap came through my area. It's a heavy weight coat that is just beautiful. The sleeves were a little snug when I wore it over a dress that was a heavy material and had bell sleeves, but was fine over a silk blouse. Someone mentioned it doesn't have pockets - it does and they're nice and deep. It wasn't NWT when I got it, but apparently nobody knew to take the stitches out of the pockets or the back vent.

links_reviews_title: Kept me warm but wish it had pockets!
links_reviews_text: This was a beautiful coat and fit true to size. It did the job of keeping me warm but my hands were left in the cold as it does not have pockets. If you don't mind that then it's definitely worth renting.

Size up. It's a really great coat for Fall/Winter because it's stylish and warm, but it only fit when I wore a t shirt under (which was still a bit small). I tried to wear it with a sweater and I couldn't bend my arms.

Wore in early fall temperatures (40°+) and it did the trick! Loved the deep pockets and sleek, full lining; there could have been one more button to allow for greater warmth, but a scarf did the trick instead. Perfect for a more formal work function or everyday warmth!

I loved this coat! I kept it for the entire season and wore it multiple times. I first rented a medium which fit except for my arms so I changed it for a large and it was perfect. I could wear it with a thick sweater under it and still button it. It was very warm and was very happy to wear this! Would recommend it for sure and was tempted to purchase it for myself.
Amazing fit and goes with everything, love it! Wish I could keep it

links_reviews_title: SO WARM! A good staple item
links_reviews_text: I loved this and would have bought it, but it was a bit over sized on me. I'm 5'4" and 110lbs.
Couldn't wear it because it was so big!

links_reviews_title: Pretty coat with good fit, especially arm length for petites.
links_reviews_text: I loved this coat. It's warm, although it doesn't button all the way up. You need to hold it closed or wear a scarf if you're going to be outside for awhile. The sleeves were not too long on my short arms. I really liked this one.
This jacket was tight in my shoulders.

I've had this coat for months and never want to give it back but could never bring myself to spend the money to purchase. I always get compliments on it and it's the perfect mix of casual and nice. Not warm enough for bitter cold days but keeps you warm enough in high 30 temperatures. Highly recommend for anyone looking to up their coat game.

links_reviews_title: Nice, but too low in front
links_reviews_text: Beautiful coat, but the opening is too much for a Philly winter.
I am one of those people for whom coats like this never look quite right, but this one fit perfectly And is very warm. Will keep for a while and considering purchasing.
Work, everyday, date night, etc. love it.

This coat is warm and perfect to wear to work. The pockets are deep and the one I got still had the tag on it. The brushed fabric was chic and the light herringbone added class. The only negative is that there are three buttons but only two button holes, so the third top one is just for show, which was a bummer because I wanted to button up and pull the wide neck a bit closer on a cold day and wasn't able to.
Kept this for almost a full month. Fabulous everyday work coat. Thick enough for cold weather.

I was worried that because this material doesn't stretch that it would be tight across the chest and shoulders, but it fit great. I loved it a lot more while wearing then when I saw it on the hanger. Great cut, material, and length (5'9") Just wish I wasn't in lockdown #covid19
For someone who has a full bust and is also petite, I really liked the fitting of the dress and how it shaped my body. The satin material feels very feminine and you will like how you feel in it.

I wore this out to dinner with my husband--the fit was true to size, and it felt like a dream on. The wide waistband was flattering, and with a black jacket and ankle boots, it was perfectly elegant. It would be great for a work day to event night. I'd rent it again.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress that could work for a variety of events
links_reviews_text: The arms fits perfectly but do have zippers on the wrist if too snug. Chest was slightly large for me but not too much of an issue. Would like be hot to wear in warm climate but good for seasonal transition dress for day to night. Would rent again.

I love how this blouse is colorful and vibrant. It feel fun, but still professional. I could definitely see myself renting this blouse again I the future! I got the larger of my size profile, next time I would try to stick to true to size.
One of my favorite rentals. The material and details are extraordinary in person. It's like a soft worn cotton but special stitching. Color is true to photo.
Great stitch detailing. A really soft comfortable poplin

links_reviews_title: Precious Top perfect for Work and Play!
links_reviews_text: Loved the sleeves and got so many compliments! I am typically a size 6/8 on top and the 8 fit perfectly.

links_reviews_title: Great every day top. Cute details.
links_reviews_text: Great every day top. The stitching and puff sleeve details give it a uniqueness. I received several compliments on it. Would rent again.

I wore this twice - back to back for different events. I wore just running errands while my kid was at school and then the next night I dressed it up a bit and wore it to casual Friday night dinner with friends! Highly recommend !

links_reviews_title: Swoon. Perfect top for any occasion
links_reviews_text: Wore for work, dinner with friends, and daytime casual. Perfect fall top.

I love all things Ulla Johnson and this top is no exception. Great fit, color and pattern. The sleeves make this top stand out from others in your closet and the stitching detail is so great. I maybe could have gone down a size but I like the wiggle room.
Was a cute tops and I received a lot of compliments. The shoulder are poofy so it did make me look more broad. I liked the print and color though. Happy I wore it once!
I wore this to work. The fit was as expected. Soft comfortable material. Length sits just below the hips. I liked the puff shoulder detail. Just enough.

I usually love Ulla Johnson, but I can't imagine who this would look good on in person. The sleeves run incredibly large and the puff/tulle lined sleeves are awful. I wore it to one meeting on my day off and every commented on my new football look. Pass!

I picked this up at the RTR shop in Georgetown. I was surprised the size 10 fit me (I'm usually a 14 or 16 in tops) and so well. I would never search sizes that small online. It was fitted but not tight, like it had been tailored. I think in your typical size it will have a boxier, loose fit. The details in stitching and poof shoulders made it interesting. I wore it for a business meeting with dress pants and to the office and shopping on the weekend with jeans and sneakers. Comfortable all cotton for warm weather.

links_reviews_title: Warning: Long sleeves, not short as described!
links_reviews_text: Blouse has nice print and unique stitching detail. Sleeves are a bit puffy and collar a bit high, but overall a comfortable true to size fit. I was frustrated however that the sleeves were long and not short as photographed and described.
loved this on someone else but it kind of swam on me! i would size down but ultimately it might not be the right fit, it was super boxy.
Turns out this color looks great on me! I wore this top to various appointments and it looked so good. Many compliments for its unique and flattering style and color.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful color & love the puff sleeve
links_reviews_text: I love the puff at the shoulders!!!! This fit me perfect. Great color. Worked great with dark denim.

I really love this blouse and received many compliments when I wore it. I wore it tucked in, although based on the cut/bottom hemline, I don't think it's meant to be tucked. But it worked and looked great. Beautiful print, love the puffy feminine sleeve and the details throughout.
This is an easy shirt, it fits true to size and I got compliments on it. My only complaint is that it was pretty wrinkled when I received it. Not properly pressed at all.
Beautiful soft cotton, cool structured shoulders, very flattering tucked in front or untucked.
Wore this on Christmas day and got lots of compliments. It was super comfy and loved the puff sleeve and stitching details. Festive blouse that works for any day of the year. Thought about buying it.

links_reviews_title: Love it! Great shape and color.
links_reviews_text: It fits great! It is well made and the detailing of the sleeves is excellent!
Great long sleeve top that goes with anything. Had a fun stitch pattern to sleeves and back and puffed shoulders for a little oomph
Pretty pattern with nice stitching details. Love the puffy shoulders. Flattering boxy cut through torso. I might buy this.
It's even prettier in person! It has beautiful details - in the shoulder (slight padding)and down the arms (embroidered).
This works with jeans, also was great at work. I loved the puffed sleeves. I have broad shoulders, but I found this shirt very flattering.
super cute, bright and happy shirt.
The sleeves were puffier than I thought they'd be, but I ended up loving the look when I pushed the sleeves up to my elbows. Got a lot of compliments. Very feminine and great for work and casual.

links_reviews_title: Comfortable and fun for work or weekend
links_reviews_text: Very easy to wear and pair with jeans or shorts
I really like the fit! The print is cute and can be worn in versatile ways
Lovely, on trend blouse. I enjoyed the boxy shape and paired this with some high-waisted jeans and sandals.
Gorgeous detailing and construction with a boxy fit. Paired with high waisted jeans and ballet flats. Received so many compliments!

This shirt is bright and fun, and the puffed sleeves and subtle embroidery details make it stand out among other blouses. It's a soft cotton/rayon that does not wrinkle easily. Works well with jeans, trousers, or skirts. Love it.
This top looks great with a pair of white jeans or white shorts. It does have a boxy fit but very flattering with a skinny high waisted pant. The balloon sleeve gives the shirt a fun twist.
The sleeves were longer than I liked so I wore them rolled to just below the elbow.
Loved this look with jeans. Very nice detailing on the blouse, with hand stitching accents. Great colors, and the blue is the perfect muted shade for jeans.
It wasn't a showstopper but was great for a day at work. Not as flattering as I thought but East to wear.

Got this brand new with tags! Beautiful, weighted fabric. Doesn't show shape as well as I'd hoped, but is pretty forgiving. Fabric is thinner than expected, just wear a slip and you're good. Great for winter, very pretty. Would recommend renting this one!

links_reviews_title: The perfect "what the heck do I wear to this?" dress!
links_reviews_text: LOVE this dress!! It fit perfectly, was so flattering and soooo comfortable! I wore it to work with brown heeled boots like the pictures show and received SO many compliments. Even my husband was impressed with how nice it looked. I had ordered 2 other "fancier" dresses in my shipment to wear to a christening and loved this dress so much I ended up wearing it again. Will definitely re-rent if not buy
I wanted this to be cute, but it just didn't work with my height. The length was awkward on my legs - it fell much lower than it does on the model (low calf).
It wasn't for my figure. Maybe after I have lost about 10lbs.
Almost bought it, but decided I probably wouldn't wear it again until the fall. But I loved the fit of it! It was super cute and comfy :)

I am between a M and L and I ordered the L. It was a bit big (true to size) so I might go with a M next time. This dress is more conservative than my usual style but it worked great for a day at the office.
This dress is nice, that material is about as thick as a light sweater. Shapewear is a must, undergarment lines will show otherwise.

links_reviews_title: Simple and classic with a touchy of sexy
links_reviews_text: At first i didn't find the dress special but wore anyway. It's very simple & not super expensive looking fabric but I actually got like 3-4 compliments & i felt like men noticed it also. It has a fun, stylish length & a simple yet elegant and somewhat sexy look to it. The fabric is a little thin so it hangs around the bum area kinda nicely & flattering if you like your bum. I wore spandex under it lol because it's thin. Yet I wore it in Boston with knee high boots and a coat and was warm enough
The dress was pretty, but very lightweight. I was not expecting a sweater dress to be so thin and flimsy. I did not end up wearing it and sent it back.

links_reviews_title: Nice dress for winter or fall
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress for a casual Friday. It was comfortable and stylish. Would rent again.
The dress was cute and great for lunching and running errands. It was thinner than I expected though.

links_reviews_title: It's a nice office outfit. I like the color and style
links_reviews_text: A little bit cold for winter weather.

I loved the fit of this dress: flowy but not baggy. Paired with dark grey boots. Material was thin but surprisingly warm. Had to wear a slip underneath because it was definitely see-through. That was the biggest con for me.
The shoulders of the garment were about five inches too big for mine. But it was very cute.

This is the first piece from RTR that I'm super excited about! I might buy it!! The blue is a great neutral for me and the pops of color on it mean I find I can mix it with lots of things in my wardrobe. It's supposed to have bra strip clips, but mine were not intact. I styled with the blazer so I'd be warm and not have to worry about it. I'm planning to tackle the blahs right now woth awesome outfits **and this had it in spades! ***

This top is so cute, but I think I would have sized down because the shoulders were stretched out or too big so the sleeves kept falling off... it was kinda hard to feel super confident because of that but I really do think it's a killer top!
The look of this is really great and the fit is comfortable. It's a fabulous top!

I really felt like a boss in this top. The gathering and stretch of the fabric around the chest and stomach section made the top really comfortable to wear. The bra strap clips on the shoulders were a lifesaver. Highly recommend wearing this with high waisted jeans since it runs a little short

Reviewing based on what I would imagine the shirt in new condition would be (the shirt I received has definitely been in rotation a while). So many compliments, beautiful print, great fit! Sleeves needed body tape to stay up, but I think the one I received was just a bit stretched out.
Cute smock top, but the shoulders do fall. I did find a little hook situation in the shoulders and was able to to put my bra strap thru!

Another hit by Tanya Taylor! So comfy and flattering. Fit true to size. The sleeves were loose so I just used fashion tape to place them where I wanted. Totally recommend for someone wanting to try something tighter but still feeling comfy!

Loved this shirt, great for hot weather. Fit well and was flattering, I could have sized down to a small the sleeves kept falling off but it didn't really bother me. The shirt still stays up even if the sleeve fell.
