Wore this to a beach wedding and it was a hit. Would recommend.

links_reviews_title: loved the color and print, makes dressing up easy since it didn't need many accessories
links_reviews_text: I got the 4 at first and it was waaaay to tight on the booty, I couldn't get in it- so I over corrected the next time and got the 8. It definitely fit in a very loose breezy way, but I probably would have been fine with the 6.

links_reviews_title: I really wish this fit!! The hips were too tight and the seams pulled across the butt.
Wide in the waist could be more flattering.
links_reviews_text: Not flattering on my body. I needed it to cinch more in the waist but it was very baggy and made me appear larger than I am. I still wore it and got lots of compliments. Smaller size would have been tight across my chest unfortunately.
It fit but i couldnt raise my arms. Cute jumpsuit though.

links_reviews_title: Not my color, but very comfortable
links_reviews_text: Wish this had been lined more. Cute jumpsuit, good fit, legs were too long for me, but I'm short.
This item is very very sheer! To the point that you could see my tattoos through it.

links_reviews_title: Runs a little small in the bust and butt but it f
links_reviews_text: Its a really pretty color and nice summer style.
See through waist/underwear area on a jumpsuit is a really impossible problem to solve! Runs small--i could zip it up but it was tight and unflattering

links_reviews_title: Warning: extremely sheer! Undergarments fully visible through this jumpsuit!
links_reviews_text: Don't eat or drink; it takes forever to unbutton and re-button this garment in bathrooms. Warning: extremely sheer! Undergarments fully visible through this jumpsuit!

links_reviews_title: Loved the color and the retro look
links_reviews_text: Would totally rent again. Tons of compliments. Perfect amount of retro with modern twist.
So not flattering. Top fit fine but the waist and belly were super tight. Not a good look.
Thought it would be more flown; but no give in the hips HIGHLIGHTER ORANGE

Was about to walk out the door when I realized you can see my underwear through it. Such a dame because this was awesome. Might work if you are wearing with spanx or am undergarment, but sadly couldn't wear
Sheer. Can see everything through it
Could not wear this because it was completely see through. The entire piece is unlined and totally sheer. I could never wear this outside!

links_reviews_title: So wish I could have worn this. :^( Too tight across the chest for 40DD
links_reviews_text: Awesome jumpsuit. Nice material. Good construction but too tight across the chest for 40DD

Wanted to love it, but it runs small in the shoulders and in the hips. There's no stretch to this at all, so I recommend sizing up. Also, very see through. You might want full body, nude spanx under this to keep your private bits private...

Loved this jumpsuit! I am between a size 6 and 8 but for jumpsuits I usually size up and the 8 fit perfectly. The length was great as well, hit mid-calf and I am 5'10". The color/print was bright and beautiful. The only downside was that is it completely see-through so you will need to wear nude under-garments or some sort of slip.

links_reviews_title: Perfect coat for a fun date out with friends in chilly New York!
links_reviews_text: The fit runs a little large- I could have sized down!
True to size coat that can be dressed up or dressed down. Very soft and warm and I get so many compliments! Wish it had a third snap on the front though.
Almost bought this jacket it's so amazing! Very warm, great length, big pockets. Goes with everything. Rent this!!
Love this coat. Warm and stylish.
Perfect with jeans or over a dress. A little big so size down if you're in between.

links_reviews_title: Runs large. Not my cup of tea overall.
links_reviews_text: This jacket is not very warm. You would need many layers to stay warm in any temp below 50 degrees. (East coast reviewer). The XS was was all that was available and it fit with some room but it then did not give the very oversized look which was a positive for me. The pockets were nice and large. Good color but wouldn't rent again.

Absolutely the best jacket! It was a replacement for a jacket I wasn't crazy about and I am in love! I ordered a size XS and it still has that baggy look to it- I'm wearing it with everything, dresses, sweats and jeans. It literally goes with it all! It has the best details with the clasp close to the neck and the 2 buttons. I joined RTR Update for the chance to buy this! Renting it again for the month of December! It's a must in your winter closet!
Got tons of compliments on this jacket! For a little big but not too bad.

Love love love this coat. It's perfect for SF winter. This coat is warm, cozy and comfy! I wore it everyday because it is not only warm but also goes well with everything - dress up or down. Color of this coat reminds me of a cuddly teddy bear. I would love to purchase it but it's little out of budget. I might rent it again soon!

links_reviews_title: Loved wearing this cute, cozy coat. Size down!
links_reviews_text: Runs super large, I was swimming in the medium. The small is still over sized but that's part of the look. It's super cozy and pretty warm, perfect for late fall/early winter and easy to layer even with chunky knits because it's oversized. I wasn't sure at first if it made me look big and boxy but I have been wearing it basically every day regardless because it's cozy and cute and goes with everything. Would recommend for a fun, easy, versatile everyday coat but definitely size down
I liked the slightly oversized, comfortable fit and the fact that you can throw it on over anything. It also had a thicker sort of lining inside that helped it look more structured.

links_reviews_title: Never want to give it back!
links_reviews_text: I am obsessed with this coat. I've had it for months and never want to give it back. It's not a really warm winter coat, but I get away with it in Atlanta. Obsessed.

links_reviews_title: Great teddy coat for that oversized look
links_reviews_text: I wore this coat for every day use. Ran a little big I should have sizes down. But - it still looked good and was great for winter and layering sweaters and blazers under for work!
I'm normally a medium, but picked a large so I could wear sweaters/layers underneath. Should have stayed with my normal size.

Love this coat! Wearing it for an everyday casual look but could definitely dress up or down. If you're between sizes I would size down because it does run a little oversized, overall its a super cozy coat!
Wore this for my 8th month of pregnancy, fit nicely over the bump. The v is cut a little low so you need a big scarf to block the wind if you live somewhere cold.
Loved!

I have been wearing this coat to work this week and it is the perfect coat to throw on over a sweater on a cold winter day. I ordered an XL and it is a bit oversized, definitely could have gotten the Large but it wasn't available at the time. So comfortable and cute.
I should have ordered a small but it is a super cute and fun jacket!
This coat is humongous and not flattering at all. The shoulder pads make you look extremely wide. Excellent quality but the style just didn't do it for me

Stunning coat but the armholes are cut extremely high and tight. That's trying it on with a thin tshirt - I couldn't even put my arms inside with a light sweater. Sadly have to return without wearing.

Like everyone else stated, it runs really small in the arms- I had to take it off when I drove because I didn't have full range of motion. You'll also want to be on the taller side as it may swallow you if you're petite. I didn't find the sleeves too 80s-ish but that could be because I'm taller and was more proportional on me. Not sure I'd rent it again because of the arms.

links_reviews_title: great everyday coat, stylish, warm, and tight on the shoulders
links_reviews_text: really love the slim fit of this coat however I wish I had gone with a size small. It was tight on the shoulders.
This coat would have been perfect if I was 5'6"... the forever struggle. But, I still loved the funky shape and stayed very warm walking around outside (I live in MI). I was very happy with it!

links_reviews_title: Warm, tailored but bulky on the top.
links_reviews_text: I kept this piece for so long and didn't want to send it back it was warm and is a lovely color. So many compliments on it. The only issue was the boxy shoulder that had me struggling with my bag on occasion.

links_reviews_title: Warm coat with an unflattering fit.
links_reviews_text: I wanted to love this coat. A well made coat in a classic color with interesting details. What's not to love? Unfortunately, it just didn't really work for me. It is a warm coat so it was functional but there's no slit at the back so it can be difficult to walk if buttoned up. The darts at the waist weren't as flattering as I hoped, the shoulders have a sort of 80s pouf/point, and the pockets are quite far back.

I absolutely adored this coat and wanted to love the fit as well, but I didn't. I'm 5'6", 130 and ended up renting an XL. The length, waist, and shoulders were too big, but the sleeves and sleeve length fit better in the XL.
Great color! Got a M, it was a bit tight in the arms but would've been fine to wear. However, it then was wide everywhere else, shoulders, chest, waist, etc. I would maybe try sizing down.
Tight in the arms and very big everywhere else - not flattering

links_reviews_title: Big coat look. Doesn't run big it's supposed to look like that...

links_reviews_text: very heavy and long for a short petite frame

Loved this coat! Warm for 30-40* weather. Beautiful structure. Arms are slim!! I couldn't hug someone in it, and putting my purse over my shoulder was tough (and I have a narrower top). Slim fit only for this one.
The jacket looked like it was made for someone at least 5'7. It was a beautiful coat, but not for anyone under 5'5
I wanted to love it, but the shoulders were so wide.. very 80s style.
I got so many compliment on this jacket ! The shoulder part is tight, so if you have larger arms then size up.

Surprised at how warm it was! Classic but trendy. The shoulder pads make the shoulders just a little too pointy looking for me, but it's not a huge issue. If you want to wear thick sweaters under it, you may need to consider sizing up!
This is a really beautiful coat, but on my 5'4 frame it was way too long. I couldn't wear it.

links_reviews_title: It’s beautiful, but it’s too small.
links_reviews_text: It came a little damaged.
Great color, fits true to size.
It's a beautiful color but the material was so heavy and it did not fit as tailored as the photos. You'd have to be pretty tall to pull this off.

links_reviews_title: I order the recommended size and it was very unflattering
links_reviews_text: The sleeves were very tight which made the shoulders stick out. The waist was far to wide compared to the tightness of the sleeves and it was like you were swimming in the jacket
had rented this with full knowledge that I'd be inside for a month straight. So cozy and so soft. I love the colors for spring.
Runs a little small, but other than that it's so soft, cozy, and not bulky in the slightest.

Ended up liking it so much I'm probably going to buy it! Definitely not a thick sweater but great for a chilly day when you wish you could just wear your pajamas. The fabric is so soft and the turtleneck is very comfortable. Maybe runs a touch small/short so if you're wanting to style it for work and weekend I'd consider sizing up. I'm normally an XS and found the S to be just cropped enough that it still works for high waisted work pants. Overall love and highly recommend!
I love this sweater it's so cute! I usually wear a small but got a medium and it fit perfectly.

This sweater is so incredibly soft but still somehow lightweight. But Tall girls BEWARE ! This sweater runs small. I'm 5'10 and I sized up with an XL and it's still cropped on me. Probably wouldn't rent again but cute nonetheless
I don't normally wear color but this piece was so fun. The fabric was very soft not itchy at all.
fits great, love the turtleneck for the winter and loved the colors!

links_reviews_title: White color is actually light purple!
links_reviews_text: Beware that what looks white on the picture of the sweater is actually a tacky looking purple color. Sweater was thin. Other than the color, the design serves its purpose for a thanksgiving dinner! Very glad I went with medium-does run on the shorter side. Medium was perfect for me.
Relaxed style for a Friday. Highly recommend for easy cute comfort.

I loved this sweater so much I ended up buying it! The material was so soft and the fit was perfect. The sweater is slightly cropped so it pairs best with high rise jeans. The sleeves and neckline all looked great.
Super soft and so cute!

The S wasn't available but the M fit pretty well (great length just below high waisted jeans), the sleeves were long on me (but because I did rent the M). Would rent again in a small! Super fuzzy and cute

links_reviews_title: Great daily sweater that's super comfy!
links_reviews_text: Good transitional piece that can be dressed up or dressed down. I wore it to a after work event and got a lot of complements on the color and how soft it was.
Such a soft sweater that gives off cute retro vibes! A bit cropped and will hit just at the top of the jeans if they are mid-rise (if you lift your arms up you can see skin).
I liked it so much I bought it. Soft, lightweight, and very flattering
Comfortable, a bit cropped sweater. Soft and not picky on your skin.
The fabric is stretchy so it was wearable but would have preferred a roomier fit. The torso is short - almost cropped.
Great colors, soft & comfortable sweater. Cropped but ok with high waisted pants.

links_reviews_title: Very soft and cuddly, but nothing special
links_reviews_text: Cute and cuddly and warm. Neck was a tad annoying throughout the night coming up so high. Cute colors but nothing special or flattering. Just a cute warm sweater. True to size. I'm a 6 and got the medium. It's slightly cropped but I wore it with regular rise jeans as I'm 5'3" and it was only visibly cropped when I raised my arms to hug someone.

links_reviews_title: Work outfit soft but too short for my body type
links_reviews_text: Incredibly soft, but definetly shorter than i expected. I have a very long torso though so not the sweaters fault. Super cute!
Wanted to wear this to work but it was actually a crop top that barely covered my belly button. I'm 5'5" on a good day, rented a small and couldn't wear it by any stretch of the imagination.

I loved everything about this dress. It's the softest material and the fit is super flattering. Definitely need to wear the belt with it to draw in the waist. I received so many compliments on the dress. I am a small usually and the small for great.
Cozy effortless shirt dress with room for my hips. Thin flowy fabric is flattering and forgiving.
Wore this for an Xmas eve gathering and got many thumbs up. The belt that comes with it is dumb and too slidey and I didn't use it.
Great dress. Soft fabric. Nice drape. Despite the fact it came w no belt and right sided belt loop was ripped, I still loved this dress. Use your own belt and prepare to be complimented.
The fit was loose yet tailored. The length was perfect for me- covered my knees but elegant not frumpy. I wish the belt would've stayed in place

links_reviews_title: A cute work dress in theory.
links_reviews_text: Beautiful print, but a bit too yellow for my fair complexion. The pockets on the chest add additional weight, giving the illusion of a much larger bust. This may be advantage to some, but embarrassing for others. Material moves well. Incredibly comfortable.
Came new with tags but still without the belt. Runs slightly large. It was cute for work but nothing special. Would have been cuter with the belt, added my own to give it some shape.

This is definitely a summer dress instead of fall dress. Love the material, Super soft and light. Feels like I'm not wearing anything :p so comfortable. True to size. It's a loose fit, size down would work as well.

Easy-going, comfy dress for days at work when you want to look fashionable, but comfortable. Cool print. Basically an mid-length shirt dress with belt to cinch waist and give you some shape. The fabric is pretty thin, but not see-through. I wore a half slip for comfort. True to size. And good for changing pregnancy bodies.

Silky midi skirt-- I wore this during the late winter but it's probably more appropriate for spring or summer because it's so light. Because of the fabric it does wrinkle while you sit during the day...probably the only reason I didn't wear it a second time!
Really like the length of this skirt. I normally wear an 8 but got a 10. I could've easily worn an 8, but it wasn't too loose. Gorgeous pattern and great for the office!
Liked the length of skirt. Was more flowy than sheath. Paired nicely with a sweater or a shirt sleeve and heels
Love this skirt. Will definitely rent again. Great silky and stretchy feel. It's long but has a decently high slit in the back. Felt very confident in this outfit.
What else can I say other than this is just a perfect skirt. It's chic and goes with so much. It's a great staple piece.
The material is thin and stretchy so if you're between sizes I recommend going down to the lower size. Also the slit in the back is pretty high

I liked this enough for it to be a worthwhile rental, but a few cons: it runs big; the slit in the back is higher than I would have liked for work; and the waist sits more at your hips, rather than your true waist.
Really liked this skirt length for work. A pop of style. High waist was flattering. Would rent again.

Gorgeous fabric, unique pattern and color combination... love the ginkgo leaf! The longer length is good for me, gives it kind of a retro vibe... the slit is high but stays classy... fits tts, but the fabric did stretch a bit over the course of the day, wish it stayed as sleek as when it started out!

links_reviews_title: Pretty pattern; background is navy, not black; runs long on shorter women.
links_reviews_text: I like the pattern on this skirt quite a bit. A few words on the colors - the background is navy, not black (I know it looks black in my photo too). The leaves have orange veining, which is subtle and quite pretty. I wore a coral top to pick up on that color. It was long on me (I'm 5'4"), which seems to be the norm with DVF skirts and dresses I've tried to date. They seem to be designed with tall people in mind. It was close fitting, with a vent in back so walking was no problem. All in all, it was a nice pick, though I would have liked it better if it had not been so long on me.
Flattering, silky feel - I really loved this skirt and got lots of compliments
This gorgeous skirt is one of my favorite rentals! It fits true to size and is high-waisted. It is so flattering and the fabric feels lux. I highly recommend.

links_reviews_title: Fun pattern, not a thick material
links_reviews_text: My main problem with this skirt is that the fabric is very thin, so it stretches a lot and does not offer structure or slimming effects. It's a fine skirt and I got compliments, but didn't feel great wearing it because I would have preferred it be more structured in the waist to offer more shape.
Nice print, conservative length but with the slit and some stretch it was easy to walk in

links_reviews_title: Didn't work no structure just silk
links_reviews_text: Didn't work no structure just silk

links_reviews_title: Beautiful and felt amazing in my skin
links_reviews_text: I order a size too big but the skirt looks amazing. Work it with a white causal fit button up and a blue blazer. What appropriate for work but still super cute in the evening.
Great skirt, super comfortable.

The flowers are much more cream than white- also have a very faint red line on all the flowers. Planned on pairing it with white top but ended up having to do navy top with cream cardigan. Felt nice- silk and therefore isn’t super slimming but still nice.

I have rented the skirt probably three times. I absolutely love it. It is perfect for the office or if you're just going out on a date; whatever the case may be. It fits true to size and… Most importantly… It is so comfortable!
Unexpected orange detail
Great piece for work. It's more of a summer item because it's a light fabric but I work light stockings and it still worked. True to size.

links_reviews_title: This was a beautiful fit, color, and style.
links_reviews_text: This was a smooth and elegant skirt. The slit in the back was a little high but the overall look at feel was outstanding! Would rent this again
LOVE this skirt. So flattering.

links_reviews_title: Didn't wear it for this event
links_reviews_text: Love the fabric and design, just runs small in tummy area.
This one swelled me up. I'm too short to pull it off.
I loved this skirt! Thin lightweight material. Very classy look. The skirt is a little long for my 5'5" frame but the slit in the back offset this. Received compliments and felt great!
This skirt was an absolute favorite! I loved the bold pattern and style made me feel like my best self. Wore for a date night, to the office and to a family gathering. Perfection!
Nice fabric. It's not super form fitting so that helps because the fabric is not forgiving to any lumps or bumps. Great for work.

links_reviews_title: The skirt was pretty, fit well , I felt good in it.

links_reviews_text: I am usually between a 6 and an 8, I wore an 8 but could have also wore a 6. Length is great below the knee but doesn't feel too conservative. The fabric is a satin like fabric but still holds a shape. The pattern was perfect for spring/summer in the office.
I loved loved wearing this skirt. I'm normally an 8 but the 6 fit me perfectly. Can be dressed up for work or down with sneakers or sandals.
good fit for tall, straight women
Long for a pencil skirt.

links_reviews_title: If you like wrinkles, this is the skirt for you!
links_reviews_text: I wanted to love this skirt, and did for the first hour I wore it to work. But then I got up and noticed that the fabric, despite being synthetic and stretchy, created and held wrinkles so that the skirt looked like an accordion. Combined with the too-high slit in the back, this skirt is a no for me, and was sent back after a single wear.
Wore this with a lightweight white blouse and it was perfect for a summer work outfit. Skirt is very flattering and gives a nice shape. Would def rent again

Pretty print. The fabric is thin and I worried it might be see thru so I wore a slip. Looked great but since the waist isn't defined it slipped around during the day. Was happy to take it off at end of day. Won't rent again

Comfortable, non-restricting with just enough stretch. I felt comfortable standing and moving around without having to worry that it would shift or look weird. Even though I am 5'8", I wish it were a tad bit shorter.
Nice light material with flattering bias cut

links_reviews_title: Thin material, high slit in the back
links_reviews_text: Comfortable and cute. Hesitated to wear it at work because of the high slit on the back
Rented these on a whim and I think I am going to end up buying them.

This is my first rental and i was really worried about the fit of my selections, especially the jeans! I struggle to find jeans that fit just right. So I got the package and took the jeans out, did a little prayer and BOOM! They fit! I loved them instantly, the style of them are so retro but modern at the same time. Really comfortable as well. Their a 10/10 in my book

These jeans are SO CUTE but if you have an hourglass figure (bigger thighs and booty) you NEED to size up at least one, maybe even 2 sizes. The legs are cut very slim and there's no stretch. I'm usually a 6/8 in denim and a 29 was too small on me. Definitely re-ordering a 30 though!
These were a little big on me but still cute. I wore them often. My only complaint is that the ankle is a little wide, so they were not true skinny jeans. Very comfortable
I love the hidden button fly. Super comfy jeans and trendy

links_reviews_title: Tight in thighs and loose in waist #curvyproblems
links_reviews_text: Jeans were tight in the thighs and loose at the waist. This is a problem I sometimes have with jeans. Very cute on but not super comfortable.
For my short girls out there, don't rent these. They are very long and don't look good rolled with booties.

links_reviews_title: Not suitable for my body type
links_reviews_text: I am very curvy, which ultimately left me unable to pull the pants up pass my thighs
Nice material, cool Rips but larger in the waist
Got these a little smaller because I've lost some weight and other reviews said they ran a bit big. Way too tight in the thigh area but great fit around the waist

I love high waisted jeans, fit me great even with narrow hips. Only a 4 star because they weren't exactly cropped high enough to be capri, but not low enough to be pants - so looked like high-waters. Always felt like I had to pull them down or up to be comfortable or wear with booties like the model pic.
It's nearly impossible for me to find light wash jeans that are actually slimming but these are the ones for me!

these jeans are great. not too skinny at ankles, great quality. no stretch. i was baffled that they were too big on me. I am always a 6 or 8 in reformation but usually a 4-6. in jeans I am a 27 so i ordered a 28 and they were oddly loose. would have ordered at least 1 size down. maybe 2.
These jeans run a little large in the waist. They are soft and comfortable, but the light wash makes them very casual. Not really appropriate for a nice restaurant, more sports game or brewery vibe!
They run a little bit but these jeans go well with just about everything - highly recommend!
fit me very well! not stretchy which is what I am used to but all worked well for the outing I wore these.

links_reviews_title: Not a skinny leg, but a straight leg
links_reviews_text: The wash of these is great, but it's definitely more of a straight leg then a skinny leg. Probably could have gone down a size as well, as there was plenty of extra room in the waist. I'm 5'6" and had to cuff them at the ankle twice to make them more of a skinny and the right length. Still waiting to see if they hold their shape or stretch out a lot after some wear...

links_reviews_title: Nice but didn't love on me
links_reviews_text: These were cute, I loved the rip but the fit was a little big on me. I thought they would be high waisted skinny jeans but they were not too skinny. I may of needed a size down but I am not sure. They are cute though.
Na
Elegant, but not too fancy

links_reviews_title: Silky but not sheer, professional but not dull
links_reviews_text: What a fantastic piece. I got a ton of compliments on the color and pattern of this shirt. It gaps a little at the bust — I am slim but have wider shoulders — so I had to unbutton one more down than I would have preferred, or I might have been tempted to purchase it. Will definitely rent again. A solid work look with jeans and a blazer. Also wore with dress slacks, but liked best with jeans.
Great button up shirt for work. Sleeves and all other proportions fit wonderful on petite frames. This brand will be my go-to for these type of work tops in future.
Big enough you can layer in colder areas or wear as single top layer if warmer; standard, nicely made and classic piece w hood as a nice touch.
Love this coat! Anything that comes with big pockets and a hood is a win for me.

Usually a medium in JCrew and this fits true to size. Worn in 15 degree weather and it did fine keeping me warm. Hood is nice and warm too. Only complaint is when zipped, its a little boxy and awkward around the front of the neck. The pockets were the best part. They had the deep pockets opening from the top and a side pocket for your hands. Loved them!
Way too big and boxy on me (5'9", 155lbs) i am usually a medium in most things but this was suprisingly big.
Worn several times for work and casual wear. Nice gold hardware, sleeves not overly long considering i am a shortie. If i rented again i would size down to L.
I thought a medium work be best for sweater weather in NY, and this jacket was far far too big. Beautiful though!
Very warm and comfortable
I got so many compliments! Good for everyday but dresses it up too! Still kept me very warm and the large pockets are so easy to use but no fear of anything falling out.
Went with everything and a perfect fit! Wore 7-10 times over the month.
The XS fit - but was still oversized. It's a very generous cut. Love how warm this it.

I love this jacket! True, it is boxy and a bit big, but it's perfect to layer in the cold winter months here in the Northeast. It's easy to fit a bulky sweater and a chunky scarf under, be warm, and STILL look chic. The fact that it is cropped makes the proportion right. Fantastic! My daughter was around over the holidays -- she wore it too! Multi-purpose, looks great on everyone.
I usually love J Crew's jackets. This one is a huge, oversized box coat but not in the cute way. On my smaller frame, it swallowed me. It was also fairly stiff and itchy. I sent it back immediately.

links_reviews_title: Order a size or two down!
links_reviews_text: Super nice quality and comfortable, but really oversized, even with a sweater underneath.

links_reviews_title: Too big but very cute, well made jacket
links_reviews_text: The jacket was too big on me (I ordered a small) and I didn't reorder because I found another I liked better. But it's a cute and well made jacket, looks expensive!

links_reviews_title: Perfect for tying together an outfit
links_reviews_text: Loved this jacket - fits true to size but I think J.Crew runs a little big so you can always size down. So cute and chic

links_reviews_title: This is a very nice warm coat.
links_reviews_text: This jacket is a great casual garment. It has perfect pockets, on the side and front. I had never seen this treatment before, but I will look for it again for sure1
I only wore this once, it runs huge. Felt really boxy, even with a winter sweater underneath.
Warm and perfect for NYC, plenty of pockets too

links_reviews_title: I love the poncho look but with full coverage. LOVE all the pockets!!
links_reviews_text: Fits just like a poncho would but you are toasty warm inside. The color is gorgeous and the zipper is super easy to use, and bulky so you can always find it.

For reference, I'm 5'0 muscular build, 125 lbs. 32C, 28 waist, 39 hips. Usually wear a small for tops. This coat seemed to run two sizes bigger. I tried to make it work and tried to wear it to school the first day I got it. It was very warm and would have loved to keep it for my entire rental period, but as soon as I stepped outside of my house, cold wind immediately got me from the bottom of the coat where it was loose. I turned around to change into a different coat. I'd definitely recommend going down a size or two!

links_reviews_title: Great for a winter weekend getaway
links_reviews_text: Runs large (can easily wear a sweater underneath). Short sleeves -- the arms of my sweater showed, which looked kind of interesting but wasn't expected or intentional.
The quality in materials is fantastic, but I would definitely size down. The shape is very boxy, which was no very flattering for my figure and style (Soft-Classic).
Jacket is an awesome every day jacket, but it runs really big. I normally wear an XL, but was swimming in the XL. If you size down 1 or 2 sizes, could be a great casual jacket.

This coat was oversized, boxy, and stiff - making it almost uncomfortable to wear. I've worn other j.crew stadium wool coats before and this one was very stiff in comparison. Did like that it had a hood though.

Pretty fabric, nicely made. The short length combined with the boxy shape wasn't for me (I have the same coat in a longer length and much prefer it longer), but it has its appeal. Beautiful camel color.
Nice and warm option, definitely size down. I wear M/L and was swimming in the large. Going to swap for a size small.
Quite boxy in fit. Very thick and warm. Pockets were deep. Wish it came in a smaller size even though I wore XXS. J.Crew's sizing is generally larger than other brands.

Excellently structured material with plenty of pocket space! I love that you can easily fit a thick knit sweater underneath, too! The only downside with the structure is that the hood doesn't really stay up and tends to droop to one side.

The skirt is really beautiful and unusual. Lots of attention to detail in the panelling. I wore to work and got tons of compliments. The belt and zip are tricky and I needed some help with those. Otherwise a perfect rental and I will definitely rent again. It could be paired with boots and a t-shirt for a more edgy look.
The way the waist of this skirt was constructed made it fit a little off. But I made it work with the belt. Overall a good skirt for one day's wear.

This skirt FEELS expensive. The navy panels are thick material while the inserts are thin. There are two belts: One adjustable belt, and one that hangs off the side for decoration. Mine did not come with the adjustable belt. The navy panels are VERY DARK navy, and when I paired it with a navy turtleneck, it wasn't really a match because my navy shirt was more blue. I think it would be better suited with a brown shirt to compliment the brown in the insert panels. I want to rent again with the matching adjustable belt included! Endless compliments and picky husband approved!
This skirt is beautiful, elegant, work appropriate, and funky all at once. Has a fullness to it, which some might not want, but it worked.

A nice fall look. The little handkerchief cutouts are super thin, so this isn't a warm skirt! Wear tights! I paired this with a vintage dark ochre tan coat I have. I wore it with a white phillip Lim sweater and French tucked the front for a shaped silhouette. The skirt is a midi with a little belt that is for show, not for use. It is flattering around the waist and hides trouble spots in the mid section.

The buttons down to the waist makes it super easy to get in & out. I wore it once to church with a pastel blazer & heeled mules and got so many compliments. Wore it another day with sneakers & a cardigan and got lots of compliments too! It'll be on my short list this summer!

This jumper is super flirty and girly. I got so many compliments! The shoulders add a really fun level of detail. The material is oddly thicker than it looks it the pictures. I have a long torso and it didn't ride up my bottom. I'm 5'4, with short legs, and you can see the length hit where my feet meet my ankles. The amount of buttons were a little inconvenient for using the bathroom, but I would rent this again!
Loved this style and fit - but it was hard to get out of when changing/going to the bathroom. Otherwise I loved it!

i liked this jumpsuit, but i didnt love it. the legs of the pants are straight leg or wide leg fit, which ended up making me feel kind of like a preppy garbage man or a little kid. the jumpsuit itself was comfortable and i liked the ruffle detail.
I LOVE THIS ROMPER SO MUCH! I wanted to buy it but too expensive. It's sooooo cute. I am short and curvy and I was super comfortable and got hella compliments!
Wore this to a day party and i was super comfortable and felt so cute. Got lots of compliments!
So light. Perfect for summer. Fit really well.
Comfy. The ruffles are very statement. The one con might it's a little too low cut up top
As always, I have a long torso and jumpers are always an issue. I loved this so much though I suffered through the wedgie!

links_reviews_title: The adult version of a baby play suit
links_reviews_text: Don't get my wrong, this is so comfy and very cute but be warned it looks like a giant baby play suit. Would recommend for a day in the park but that's pretty much it. Very juvenile but had fun wearing it! Fits true to size

This jumpsuit was an easy outfit to put on when running errands or getting lunch with a friend. The fabric is light and comfortable. I'm 5' 3" and I had to roll the cuffs twice for it not to look weird.
I got the large and it was a tad big on top but still super cute for a dinner with my husband on vaca! Felt chic yet casual.

Really enjoyed this jumpsuit! I went up a size because I have an hourglass shape and wanted to make sure I had room for my hips. The tie-waist really makes the sizing a little flexible. I'm 5'0 and the jumpsuit hit right at my ankle. The colors and pattern are fun and unique. Only downside is that it gets quite wrinkly, but still looked cute throughout the day.
Runs a tiny bit big (especially around the waist) but it was like wearing pajamas. Color and details (flare on sleeves) make this a fun, bright option for warm weather

I love this romper so much! Fit is perfect- length was long cut off at my ankles great with wedge or flats. Didn't wrinkle after long car rides. So comfortable was nervous about going pee as there was so many buttons however they were easy to undo.

SO CUTE! So many compliments every time I wore this. It's comfortable, versatile, fits like a dream, is lightweight and breathable. Can dress it up for a dinner or shower or be super casual with it. Love this piece and I don't want to give it back!!!
As with other RTR jumpsuits, I've learned to size up. True for this. So much fun. Pockets! The buttons up the front are real... keep that in mind for the bathroom.
I loved the pattern and ruffle detail. Super easy and cute to wear

links_reviews_title: This was a nice print, but for tall people (5 10), it was just not comfortable
links_reviews_text: I couldn't wear this because it wasn't long enough for me, but would've been cute otherwise.

Comfortable cotton jumpsuit, would be great for summertime. Fabric is lightweight and does not itch. Very cute feminine print. I rented this off season so it was too cold to wear out- ended up hanging around the house on a sunday and running errands in it. Length is perfect, crops right above the ankle for me so looked good with casual white sneaks and sandals. Pockets are a good touch. Only negative is there are several buttons you would have to undo to use the restroom so keep that in mind.

I wanted to like this but just couldn't. The length for a petite 5'2" person is too long and the legs weren't very tapered making me look shorter and squatter. There were also just a ton of buttons to button making going to the restroom harder than normal.
Will rent again, maybe even in an XS. Light fabric, best for summer
Loose fit-casual and cozy
My torso was too long for this.. consider sizing up for length.. didn't wear it because of this.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a fun night out!
links_reviews_text: I loved this jumpsuit so much, especially the top half. If it was something I owned I definitely would have altered the legs to be a bit more tapered but still super cute.
Comfortable and super cute. After sitting in it at the office, the backside was a little saggy.
Good fit

It was pretty long and baggy on me, I am 5 feet tall. I didnt even like how it looked with heels, but I wanted to wear it with sneakers to wear on vacation. Wish it was shorter or I was taller! The top was very cute though.

I had been eyeing this jumpsuit for a while and was so excited to finally get it. The fit was great (even for athletic leg girls). I got so many compliments all day wearing it. The booty area did seem to stretch a bit after sitting for a while at work and kind of bubbled out.

links_reviews_title: Have ordered this twice now because it is such a statement piece
links_reviews_text: Looks great with white sneakers. It runs big so go a size down. Length is a little short so it's best for short girls
So cute and comfortable!

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable & adorable at the same time. Felt young & trendy & confident!
links_reviews_text: Lots of compliments on this outfit. It was cut a little low, but looked great with a tank underneath!
Wore this jumpsuit for a casual work retreat. I got a ton of compliments and it's very cute but runs large and really loses its shape throughout the day. Also not great if you're on the taller side.
Pajama
This fit sinches in all the right places. Very cute for spring parties!
Very light material so great for SoFlo weather :)

links_reviews_title: Cute jumper, looked like a baby
links_reviews_text: The jumper was comfortable and perfect for a garden party. I felt a bit like a baby with the ruffles.
This jumpsuit is a really sweet style and super fun print. It fit TTS but I did not wear it because it was missing the top button on front.

links_reviews_title: Very cute, fits well, unique style!
links_reviews_text: Very annoying for going to the bathroom because it has a million small buttons!!

links_reviews_title: So adorable, lots of compliments, even from my designer friend.
links_reviews_text: Fit snug, but buttoned in the chest perfectly with my chest 34 d.
Loved this sweatshirt! So comfortable and still classic!

links_reviews_title: Cropped!! but cute for the right body type
links_reviews_text: I really wanted to love this but it just didn't work on me... not sure if it's due to over-laundering, but it was more cropped than it appears on the model so it had a different fit than I expected. It was still a cozy sweatshirt, but cropped baggier tops don't really work on my Pear-shape body, so it wasn't the most flattering.
I have broad shoulders & large upper arms, so I ordered a L. The fit of this sweater is very loose, so the L was too baggy for me. Wish I had ordered a M.

links_reviews_title: Cute cozy and perfect for a cold winter day
links_reviews_text: Loved the feel of the fabric and coziness overall. Will probably rent again
This was a cute retro sweater shirt perfect for running errands or coming out of the gym. It did not work for me as it was a little too short in the body and the sleeves were too short.
This sweater is super soft and comfy. I super love it. It's one of those things that you can throw on easily and still feel put together.

Looking to spice up your causal wear? This sweater has fun geometric design to it and a gold zipper to match your jewelry to. Not super warm, more of a lightweight sweater that runs a bit small. Good for pairing with highwaisted pants though - so in that case would run normal.
Super cute for running errands

This sweatshirt was surprisingly warm! It was soft and comfortable; I didn't have to wear it with an undershirt. The color blocking is cute. I got a small and it was a little bit baggy but that was the fit I wanted from a sweatshirt.
True to size. Feels great. Warm and cozy

links_reviews_title: Cute, but not for tall people
links_reviews_text: Liked but didn't love this. The inside wasn't as soft as the outside, and it was a little short on me, despite me being only 5'5" with an average length torso. Found myself adjusting it a lot through the day. If you're tall I definitely wouldn't recommend even though it was cute and comfy. Was true to size for the rest of the fit though
I love the look and it's so soft. I'm totally going to buy it

I loved this so much. It came new with tags, so no wear and tear, which was great. The inside is more of a sweatshirt material (instead of fleece like the outside) so it's warm, without being overly hot. Perfect for fall, and stylish enough to make a casual outfit still look put together. I'm obsessed.
I wore this outfit to teach a yoga class. Comfy and fun.

I was worried when I opened up my shipment but it is really one size fits all. There was some roll down on the waist so ok for in the house and you can see through the material so I would need a long shirt if wearing out. Its navy blue. Thought it was black
I was skeptical when I saw one size and I was right.. These leggings are tiny!
too short for me 5'8"

I was in a rush and just picked these real fast and ended up wearing them to work and to meet a senator. I'm an 8 normally and these fit great and were not see through. They are a pretty sparkly blue. I dressed them up and subdued the bling by pairing them with the Navy Knit Insert shirt by KaufmanFranco and black boots and it was the cutest outfit that could be worn anywhere.

This simple dress exceeded my expectations. I thought it was very casual dress but the material and two tone colors make it a little more sophisticated. It is light but has lining on the bottom. Material has a little stretch. Medium fit perfectly for me with a little room to spare. It's short but at 5'3 and wearing black tights, I had no issue wearing it at work. My only con is it's hard to zip up (feels like it's going to get caught) but that's obviously not a deal killer.

This dress was very cute and comfortable! The material is thinner than I expected, but it has perfect amount of stretch and softness. The length was as short as I would go for work with tights (and I'm 5' 3"), so taller girls be aware. I will definitely look to rent this one again!

The dress is so cute and different with the two tones. I love the length. It's a little short but still passes the finger length test. I wore it with flat boots and it looked so put together for work. This is a great work to happy hour look. I'm debating on buying this dress...
Very comfortable. I think the style suits small busted women well.
This dress is ok for work. A little short on my 5'7" frame. Nothing some thick tights couldn't fix. Was nice for a cold, snowy day, but just not that memorable. Seems to run a little small.
Fun dress, a bit short but with tights it was fine. Got several compliments. Wore it to work and out to a show with family paired with black over the knee boots.
Fits true to size- sleeves were 3/4 with my long arms Comfortable warm not too heavy Not fitted but not boxy either No itch Came mid thigh at 5'6

links_reviews_title: Comfortable, warm dress good for work
links_reviews_text: I sized up and glad I did. It fits comfortably and hugs in the right places. The only strange thing is the shoulders. They almost come to points and I can't tell if it's design or from hanging weird on a hanger. A nice variation of a LBD.

Super cute dress, very stylish and fits. The medium was a little loose but was work appropriate, the small would've fit but would be better for date nights/when you want something more form fitting. The length and weight of this dress were perfect - would definitely rent again.
Nice Dress. Worn to Broadway show, with Tights. It's shorter than expected, but looks nice with boots.
I wore this to work recently, including a luncheon and it was very comfortable and I received multiple compliments. Very flattering! A little short, but fine with black hose or tights.
Comfy and warm. Good fabric quality. Great for work

links_reviews_title: Very flattering and comfortable. I received many compliments on this dress.
links_reviews_text: Very comfortable!

links_reviews_title: Love it! But it is quite short
links_reviews_text: Fits like a dream and looks great with opaque tights and OTK boots! Only issue was that it's pretty darn short! Still work appropriate but marginally so! Still - it was flattering and comfortable, still a win in my book!
Nice dress, that was comfortable for work. The white is actually a little dingy looking, but otherwise I liked it for work.

links_reviews_title: A little too short for a work dress
links_reviews_text: This dress was good quality- just a little too short for me to wear to work. Pros- figure flattering, nice design, good quality

links_reviews_title: Dress hugs curves in the right way
links_reviews_text: Stretched enough for my hips
Dress fit great, comfortable, length was great for work. I wore with black tights and boots.
Fit pretty true to size and was a really soft material. I am definitely going to rent this again!
cute dress for work... I'm 5'8'' and found it a bit short without tights

links_reviews_title: Great pick! This one works perfectly for both work and weekends
links_reviews_text: Fits well. Great length to wear to work
Cute and comfortable. Very work appropriate with a fun asymmetric design.
This was long on me, I had planned to wear it with tights but it looked very matronly.
I thought this would be a good work dress. Wrong! It's like a mini dress and the sleeves are tight too. Had to send it back immediately.
Not sure why I keep renting from this designer because their clothes run very small. This can not possibly be a large. Beautiful dress but way too small.
Flattering shape. Office-appropriate fit. Simple but interesting/eye-catching design.
Dress is thick, and warm. Perfect for my work event with the executive team. Wore this will knee high boots- perfect, fashionable outfit for fall work vibes

These are perfect. Flattering, good support, and very comfortable. I took them to Europe and wore them on the flight they are so comfortable. And I wore them with everything else too! I'll rent them again for sure.
The fit is great; true to size, way comfortable. Not at all like leggings, but just as flexible. Would definitely purchase if I could afford them.

They look like jeans but feel comfy like leggings. The waist band is a thick elastic band. I really liked the waistband and it really holds you in and makes the jeans very flattering in the tummy area. I wore these from morning til night for a college football game out of town trip. They were so comfortable! I will rent again in the future.
I love these pants. They have all the benefits of leggings but they are also quality denim. I am a few weeks postpartum and these are perfect for me now but I will rent them again later too!
...but ran too big. Will definitely try again in 30
Jeans that are cute, but comfy like leggings. I would definitely size down one or two sizes...very stretchy. Perfect to wear on pasta night:)
Fit well and great length.
These are not necessarily the most flattering jeans I've ever worn in my entire life, but they are very easy I wore them so frequently that I am considering buying, a nice go to for every day where.

links_reviews_title: Love the stretchy waist and fits me perfectly. LoveJ Brand

links_reviews_text: These were incredible. Ran a little big. Great wash/color.
Comfortable! But got loose in the knees after sitting for a few hours for travel.

I just had a baby late last year and as I'm losing the baby weight, I've been wanting some clothes that look cute without buying clothes in sizes that I won't be wearing for too long. Also super important, is that I'm comfortable. Well these were exactly what I needed. I'm not quite fitting into my old jeans yet and these fit true to size. The waist band was super comfortable on my waist and they look so great. The length is just perfect. Would've bought these if I knew my size would be consistent, so instead I plan on continuing to rent in different sizes as my body continues to change.
Super cute and comfortable. I'm 5'5" and these are short and show a lot of ankle, would be better in spring/summer but I'll tuck them into boots.

links_reviews_title: Comfy enough for a lazy day and classy enough with a blazer for work!
links_reviews_text: I wore these tons of times with sweatshirts, sweaters, tees and finally with a blazer and blouse for work. I really like them and would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Loved them; ended up buying them
links_reviews_text: Loved them; ended up buying them

links_reviews_title: I would rent these pants again.
links_reviews_text: Fit was perfect!!
I am typically a 27, wore and 26 and still felt like they were too baggy for a skinny jean. Definitely size down! The waist band made them SO comfortable.
These are the most comfortable pants I ever have worn. They are alittle baggy in the ankles but it doesn't even matter. I want to live in them and I am debating purchasing.
I was expecting a full length on these based on the model/photo. These were a good 5 inches above my ankle. Otherwise fit was true to size and quality was great.
They were perhaps a little large - didn't do anything for me, and would not rent again. Comfortable they were, though.

Very comfy but runs large. Size down if you want them to fit like skinny jeans. I'm pretty much always a 27 and could have used 26 in these. The waist band makes it comfy but it's not cute so make sure you're wearing a long shirt.

These are stretchy and comfortable and I love the easy high waist. I am short and these hit just below my ankle so full length for a skinny jean but not too long. They run at least a size large. I am a 12/14 in jeans and the 31 was a bit loose in the legs so I will try a size smaller next time. Also since they have a lot of stretch they do stretch out some as you wear them. The quality and color are great so I will probably rent again.

links_reviews_title: B+ Jeans, great for a tunic
links_reviews_text: Really nice pull-on style (would be very forgiving post-partum), but they stretch out after a day. Good to rent, wouldn't buy.

links_reviews_title: Soooo comfortable!! Fit perfect! Length was perfect too

links_reviews_text: Weird elastic band around waist, but comfortable!
Fits well, flattering and comfy

These are leggings but at the top they have a black waist band and that's the only thing they did not like about them. The band digs into your stomach and is a bit uncomfortable after awhile. Otherwise they are a pretty color and good quality fabric. I'm petite and they fit me regular length so if you are taller they could be shorter for you.

I've ordered these twice first in my regular size which fit fine, but I size down the second time and they fit a little bit better – if you want a fitted look I would go one size down. Comfortable elastic band waist fitted throughout with stretch

These jeans fit like a glove. They hold you in and make everything look nice and tight. They stay snug throughout the day and do not sag or loose their shape. I like to tuck my shirts into my pants to create more defined waistline and that's my only hesitation with these pants as you can see the elastic if you do that on the waistband. Would purchase these.
I thought they were black in the photo, but they're actually dark denim. Still cute though!
I sized up on these pants thinking there was no way RTR's recommendation would fit. I won't do that again. My guess was too big and I bet RTR's size would have fit.

Cute jeans! I'm usually not a "jegging" person, but these fit pretty well. Great Jean material. Dark blue. They look black in photos. A little short for my height but I wore them with boots. I have photos but they are not loading correctly…
Jeans have elastic waist, very smooth fit? Jean material is stretchy but still look and feel like denim.
Comfy!

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable for an everyday wear.
links_reviews_text: The material was very stretchy. Had to down size. But it felt very comfortable wearing it. Love it!
Super cute pull on jeans. Tight fit. Nice color.
Reminded me of my maternity pants because of the elastic band. Was a little big

links_reviews_title: Cute but short for tall girls!
links_reviews_text: I rented this dress for work, and had read the reviews that it ran short, so I sized up. It fit well and was indeed short, but ended up being fine with tights (my office is super casual). The material is pretty lightweight and wrinkles easily, but is also very very soft. Would rent again!
This ended up being more casual than I thought it would be upon ordering. Still a fine basic dress. A little short for work but made do with tights!

I totally loved this dress. It runs large but still flattering and didn't really gape at the chest, which is a rare win for me. I don't think I could have worn it comfortably without tights, but it wasn't too short. The only downside was the collar - it didn't quite lay properly on the left side.

Loved this dress, was exactly what I expected when I ordered. Especially liked that the back is SLIGHTLY longer than the front so when it's all cinched it creates a beautiful shape. So so cute I wore this a ton!
Got lots of compliments- great for work but must wear with opaque tights as it runs a tiny bit short in front (longer in back by design)

links_reviews_title: Just what I was looking for
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress for work. Was very comfortable and fit perfectly, if not a bit loose. I would love to own this dress.

I rented a little too big. The dress is definitely true to size. I paired with a belt and boots for my day out in San Francisco! Loved channeling my inner gossip girl vibes and got tons of compliments! Great comfortable dress for all day wear!
Really loved this dress. No issues with gaping in the chest area and got a ton of compliments. Definitely different from what I usually go for but I'm happy I tried it out!
Love this dress with the ruffle top and bottom. Lovely light material (watch out for the wind!). The fits great with the adjustable waist, I could have gone down to a medium.

links_reviews_title: Darling for work video calls and hang time!
links_reviews_text: Easy breezy dress. Perfect for several lockdown events - work video calls (nice color on camera) and for making dinner for the husband. Comfy and cute. Looked great with tights or even with my Uggs when I took my dog for a walk around the block. I wore it about three times in a week before I sent back!

This dress is so cute and versatile for everyday or work. I wore it twice, once out to a casual dinner with my husband and once to work. Both times I paired with knee-high leather booths and opaque tights. I did needed the tights for the length at work and they also helped keep me warm at dinner. Big fan of this. The top does run a smidge big and I may have been able to size down overall except for the length.
Super comfortable, good length and adorable with tights and boots!
Got a lot of compliments and felt very cute all day! Wore over tights and booties.

I wore this versitale dress 3x --to a supper club concert, a date night and to work --all with different tight and shoes. It was comfortable and because of its drawstring waist you could cinch it to make it shorter and more eveningish and pair with combat boots or flat over the knee boots. It's been my fav item from RTR so far.
I should have rented a small but I fear it would be extremely short. Otherwise cute dress with jeans or sneakers. Easy to wear

links_reviews_title: Cute, but definitely a lot of materials an should have gone a size smaller.
links_reviews_text: Order a size down. Will be cute for winter with tights and boots. A little on the long side for anyone short.

I usually wear a size L in dresses but sized up on this one for work. The dress overall ran pretty true to size- i could definitely get the L next time, but for work I wanted it a little looser/longer. Only problem I had with the dress was that the buttons in the front make me feel like the dress is going to pop off at any time. Overall would rent again though.

links_reviews_title: Making it through the weekend with this stylish coat! 😃
The cut is what drew me in, the color is what kept me interested
links_reviews_text: Material/fabric is super soft, nice quality and maintains its structure. quilted lining gives it weight and warmth, but not overly heavy or bulky. The color is really nice, like a rich caramel. I was worried the color would look bad, but really like it. The cut & design of coat is simple & classic; clean lines w/ an oversized casual feel. Fits great in the arms, shoulders, and length is exactly right on me. Least fave are the 4 red-edged buttons, but that's easily overlooked.

This jacket is such a great color and the fit allows you to wear your fave winter outfits without worrying if your sleeves will be too tight. I've received so many compliments on it. Definitely a fave!
It's a little oversized but I think that's the style. Love the color and the look!
This a good one. Better than the plain brown or black.

I get more compliments on NVLT coats than others that cost 3 or more times as much. More of a paprika color than yellow marigold. Warm, with a cute, quilty lining. Really nice fabric & everyone comments on the unique buttons. Highly recommend!

Obsessed with this coat. Looks good with everything, is super warm and quilted on the inside, and is the most gorgeous vibrant camel color. Buttons are red trimmed which I didn't realize from online pics. Nice touch!
Love the color, and it's nice and warm. It's definitely more boxy, which lends itself nicely to a more tomboy-ish style.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful Color and Inside, Fits Bulky
links_reviews_text: Love the feel and color and look, great for this winter wedding! I am a S/M so I got both sizes but the M would have been way too big. Not too firm fitting.

links_reviews_title: Great for a NYC trip. A tiny bit roomy
links_reviews_text: Wore this various times for a NYC trip. It was super cute and warm enough. I would say it's a bit roomy and if you're looking for a more tailored look, I'd probably size down. Would rent again and do so myself!

How can something feel too old and too young at the same time? I looked like I was raiding my mom's closet, or borrowing from my Gen Z friend. It has a vintage vibe that just wasn't quite my style and the color was a little too bold for my taste. Size down.
Tons of compliments on the color! It keeps you warm and has such a classy look. I'm considering not sending it back!

links_reviews_title: Love the color, hate the lack of pockets
links_reviews_text: I felt glam in this coat, but since I wasn't sure if i should cut the threads making the pockets nonfunctional, I didn't reach for it much. Also we had an unseasonably warm Nov/Dec so it's not all the coats fault! I like the attention to details with the red sides buttons and the red interior. The coat itself is soft and warm!

I rented this for a few days in Lake Tahoe over the holidays. It has a padded liner which made for extra warmth. It is slightly oversized and can be big if you don't wear chunky sweater, etc underneath. Very warm though, great color, would definitely rent again
I'm a medium in everything, but am waiting for a small to get back in stock so I can order it before returning this one. The medium feels pretty big.
Super soft and extremely comfortable, this is the best of both worlds in terms of warmth and style. Love this coat!!
perhaps a tad too mustardy for my tastes, but it was definitely cute. boxy shape!

links_reviews_title: Way too boxy if that's your style. It played with proportions in a cartoonish way. Not for my taste.
links_reviews_text: Fit - large

I wore this for a long trip to NYC in January, and it worked great: perfectly warm, a soft quilted lining, and much more interesting than my usual winter coat. This coat does have a more "oversized" fit, so factor that in if you have preferences on how it wears. I typically paired it with a scarf to add extra warmth since it only has a couple buttons.

I lived in this coat for the month! The pockets are great and the red accent on the buttons are unexpected. It is big and warm and fits over everything. Lots of compliments. The only minus was how low the V is when buttoned up. Need a big heavy scarf on a cold day to cover the chest. But this didn't prevent me from wearing it ever. Would rent again when it gets cold

links_reviews_title: Nice jacket, lots of compliments. Great color!
links_reviews_text: fits a little big and boxy.
Everywhere I went I got compliments on this coat! Small not is that its a little big in the chest area so I would wear a bundles scarf underneath for a snug fit! But otherwise it was amazing!
I loved this coat, I'm using it almost everyday and I'm thinking on buy it haha. The color is beautiful and I like the details like the red buttons.

links_reviews_title: Lots of compliments and great color.
links_reviews_text: This is designed to fit large, but I loved the fit and the lining. Definitely keeping it. Not too long for my short frame.
Got so many compliments on this coat! Color was unique, but still matched a ton of outfits. I also liked how the cut was loose, yet structured. Loved this coat so much, and decided to purchase it.
Wore this coat a ton. Great for work but also worked well to throw over my workout wear to look more polished. Color is a universal color alternative to basic black that looks good with everything.

links_reviews_title: The color, the buttons, the pockets. Compliments galore.
links_reviews_text: Obsessed.

This is a beautiful and well-made coat. It's surprisingly warm and was great for dressing up my holiday outfits. However, I recommend sizing down as it was basically swallowing me. I am 5'10", 170 lbs and typically wear a large in tops/coats. I ordered the L but I wish I would have gotten the M in this.
needs some fitting, too large for height

links_reviews_title: Loved the color but had to return.
links_reviews_text: Definitely an oversized fit, so size down! I personally love a more tailored coat and this one had dropped shoulders so I sent it back. It was beautifully lined and could be dressed up or down. The color was also even prettier in person!
But size down (maybe two sizes!) was unable to wear because it was so big.

I ordered this coat for everyday wear. I like the oversized feel of it and drop shoulder feature. My arms are always an issue when it comes to finding a nice coat, so I'm glad this worked out well and kept me with enough arm room. So far I layer this coat with my hoodies for extra warmth. Perfect for fall weather .

links_reviews_title: Wore it for a week straight
links_reviews_text: Loved this mustard color!!!

links_reviews_title: Will keep you warm & stylish in DC
links_reviews_text: Runs a bit large, but thatʻs okay as I rented this for a business trip to D.C. in November. The color matches the fall leaves and will keep your coat a stand out among the sea of dark coats on the street.
Am always a M - coat was giant through waist - I get the oversized look but this just looked dumpy. Returned.

links_reviews_title: Great day to night jacket, very warm!
links_reviews_text: I rented this for a trip to NYC and Toronto, this jacket looked great to wear over workday wear and worked well for dressing up. I ordered a medium and where the style is a bit oversized I wouldn't have sized down but if fitted is your dream, I'd size down. Really enjoyed this coat and it was very warm!
This fit a little big but I think it's supposed to be a little oversized. The big drawback is it doesn't have pockets! Freezing hands! But it was really cute.

Really cozy and warm, however it was a little tight around my hips and had a tiny bit of pull around the buttons that didn't look cute. I wide hips and a big butt though, it fit perfectly (maybe even a bit big on the top) otherwise.

The coat itself is great quality and warm. If you're looking for an oversized coat, this ones for you. The color is perfect for everyday wear and matches to a lot of clothes. I accidentally got a size larger, so couldn't wear it. But would definitely get in my right size
Beautiful coat, the color is amazing. It is a heavy coat. It runs large, I usually wear M and it was huge on me.

links_reviews_title: Not a fan of this neckline
links_reviews_text: I would have worn this if the neckline wasn't so gaping and wide. When I turned to the side I could see inside the shirt to my shoulders. It's extremely clingy so it didn't look nice over jeans. I think it would work best for a thin small chested person with a nice tummy ;)

links_reviews_title: Conservative work top with just a bit of flair
links_reviews_text: Good quality, form fitting without being too tight, conservative (deep bordeaux/maroon) color and overall silhouette. The neckline is where the bit of flair comes in. It is more rectangular (as opposed to upside-down trapezoidal shape in the product photo) shape.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful color, but might have been better sized down.
links_reviews_text: Quite low cut and you need a bra that sits very wide (right near your armpits). Sleeves very long, had to fold them up.

links_reviews_title: Wore to work with black skinny jeans
links_reviews_text: Nice cut and good quality. Did ride up a bit as I wore it

links_reviews_title: I had accidentally ordered in Large and was hence not able to wear it as the cut would be too deep.
links_reviews_text: I had accidentally ordered in Large and was hence not able to wear it as the cut would be too deep. Its a beautiful sweater though.

I was not able to wear this. I normally wear a 16 but didn't notice that I was being sent a size up. The shirt was way too big. I think the correct size for me may be better and l'll resize and try again.

links_reviews_title: Hard to wear with the neck line color is great but wearing a bra is impossible
links_reviews_text: Cute but not practical

I have narrow shoulders, a small bust, and a long torso (but also curvy), which seems to have been a bad combination for this top. If I arranged it so the shoulders fit, the neckline was low and wide enough that it was unavoidable that my bra was exposed. The length was also short on my waist and didn't lay nicely over jeans. Overall not flattering at all, wouldn't even take a photo for the review. Super disappointing, because I thought it was really cute! Hopefully it works better on others.
fits a little long in the sleeve

links_reviews_title: I really loved the material of this top and the colour. I maybe should have sized down.
links_reviews_text: I couldn't wear bra straps with this top if i moved at all you could see all the way to my shoulder and it was very revealing which i don't mind but i don't like that you could see my bra.

I love the fabric and color of this and really wanted to love it. But my shoulders are too narrow for it - it not only kept falling off when I tried it on. The torso fit perfectly so I couldn't go down a size.

links_reviews_title: Amazing top but a little short.
links_reviews_text: Loved the color and material but unfortunately it was a little short and you couldn't pull it down without showing your bra as it has a square chest. Overall, I loved it but would not suggest if you are concerned with showing the top of your pants.
Love the look of this shirt but the arms were too long and the front was so low it did not cover my bra. Had high hopes but had to return.
Love this top, gives you a sexy look without having to do too much. Comfortable, thick material that stretches to give you a flattering figure.
classic gray jean with an undone hem. runs a tad big. pick your regular size for a comfy feel or size down to go for a fitted look.

These jeans fit me so well! I wore them 3 days straight while on vacation and felt hip and appropriate everywhere I went. In this pic they are styled with the Levi's studded jacket I also rented for the weekend via RTR. They do get looser with wear so just be aware.
Loved these jeans so much I almost bought them. The color was so unique and the fit was so comfortable. They sit high and snug with a straight leg and frayed hem. They did stretch with wear. Loved!
They're a lot like they look on model. Not so in love with the fake wear pattern on the fronts of the hood, but will be wearing happily.
Love these jeans. Surprised they fit so perfectly. I'm 5'1" and the length is perfect. They're great everyday jeans not uncomfortable and don't dig in to your waist even though they are high waisted.

Love these jeans. They stretch as you wear them, which is normal for good jeans material. I loved wearing them! I wore them probably 5 times within 2 weeks. They go with almost everything and are the perfect high-waisted height. They're a bit cropped which isn't preferable, but paired with boots they're perfect.
These jeans are so cute, comfortable and have a great cut. I really wanted to keep them but they were a little too loose in the waist for me keep - I could probably size down to a 27R.

links_reviews_title: Great alternative to sweatpants for these quarantine days :)
links_reviews_text: These are SO comfortable. Just enough stretch without losing shape. Love!

links_reviews_title: Super nice jeans so I bought them
links_reviews_text: Loved these. Loved the fit, loved the undone crop. I really couldn't believe how inexpensive these jeans were to begin with - I am so glad I tried them on that I ended up buying them.
So Ive had these for 3 weeks now and they are my weekend staples on repeat plus a work-wear 1xweek. Need these in your life. Good bye skinny jeans.

links_reviews_title: RENT THEM! I love these jeans!
links_reviews_text: these jeans are everything. SO flattering. Tall girls -- know that these are slightly cropped / on the shorter length. They look super cute with some heeled booties. I wore these multiple times a week. To class during the day and with sneakers to the bar at night. They are not high waisted per se but fit well.

links_reviews_title: Big in waist small in hips big and bulky in thighs and floods on me. NOPE

links_reviews_text: The style was fine - the fit was ok initially but then it stretched quickly. Nothing special.

links_reviews_title: Loved these jeans! Sad to return!
links_reviews_text: These jeans fit wonderfully and brought a stylish, edgy look to every outfit. I've committed to refrain from buying new clothes this year, but I would definitely buy these otherwise and wear them all the time. They go great with everything and were so comfortable.
RTR recommended this size, way too small and seemed smaller than a normal 25 pant. However, the pants are very cute and I will hopefully rent the larger size in the future!
Beautiful jeans just was squeezing the life out of me in the 26. I'd order again but size up to a 27.
Most jeans gape at my waist in order to fit my apple bottom. These do not. They fit great at the waist. They are the perfect length, with just enough distress. Love these!!
First time trying jeans on RTR and these did not disappoint. Fit without gapping at the top and the cut is perfect for booties.
Cons - they didn't lift my butt and made it look flat Pros - they're black.
This zebra wrap dress is true to size for the most part the sleeves are pretty long.

Runs large everywhere Arms were loose that didn't bother me as much as the overall largeness - I even tied it as tight as I could Felt robey ish Silky smooth comfortable fabric Warm Be careful of open slit in front Low cut and open in chest area- I wore a bodysuit underneath Great colors
The fabric on this is too slippery, wore out and about once, not sure if I recommend. The dress is just okay.
It was too small... fit in the shoulders but did not wrap around my breasts. And the fabric was pretty heavy. I like the look of it in the picture but did not like the color once I got it.

links_reviews_title: Light and super flattering for person with high waist and long legs.

links_reviews_text: I'm a size 4 in most things and wish I had sized up from a small to a medium. This dress was too short waisted for me to wear.

links_reviews_title: The Tiger print was very fun to wear!
links_reviews_text: Great dress but was a little bit of a disaster to wear. The fabric was so slippery that the tie kept loosening and I spent the whole day worrying about a wardrobe malfunction. Also felt that the dress on its own was too much because of the print, so wore with a black blazer to soften.
Loved the look of this dress , but it runs REALLY small . Ordered medium , no way it would fit Then swapped for the large , still too small . Just gave up and sent it back .

links_reviews_title: Typically wear a 6, could have done a small
links_reviews_text: I'm tall and fairly thin. This dress ran slightly large in the top. It would have fit better if I had bigger boobs. I'm usually a size 4 on top, size 6 on the bottom, ordered a medium and probably should have gotten a small. Pros: I got a lot of compliments on it. One coworker said it was "stunning" and that I should wear it for a big presentation. Cons: the fabric is so slippery that the knot that holds the dress together untied itself in a meeting even though I had it double-knotted. Even with a quadruple knot it was dicey - I had to keep checking it during the day and was wishing for a safety pin!
I loved it but it was a but small in the bust
This is a really pretty dress. The fabric is lovely. It's a wrap and I generally prefer a wrap that is more covering. Also it was too low-cut for my comfort.

Neckline had a deeper plunge than expected. Overall, the dress is much less suitable for work than I had guessed based on the model photos. Too low-cut and right across the chest, plus I'd be terrified it would open down below...

links_reviews_title: Everyday wrap dress that easily dresses up for an event
links_reviews_text: Runs about a half size small, especially in arm length and in the bust area. It's longer than pictured on me and I am fairly tall. Needs to be retied regularly due to the slippery, satiny material. Great, rich, deep color.
Beautiful #work dress. However, not made for #fullbust women.

This dress is extremely low cut and was so tight across my chest that I couldn't even pin it. For reference, I'm only a C cup and I had the small. The length was nothing like the picture with the model. It was mid-calf on me and I am 5'6! The material was beautiful and this dress had so much potential...

Soft dress, love the fabric and the print. Downside is it runs super small. Thankful I got a Medium vs. Small as the ribcage was still tight and the ties don't go all the way around. And as usual with wrap dresses, if you're bustier it's pretty revealing.

links_reviews_title: Nice dress but runs way too small
links_reviews_text: I think anyone who rents should size up..it’s a lovely dress but runs small

links_reviews_title: Windy days & a wrap dress don't mix
links_reviews_text: This dress has a great pattern but the material is so silky that it slid all over the place at my desk and meetings. It's a wrap dress so hold it closed.

links_reviews_title: It was just FUN! and I have the perfect pair of boots !!
links_reviews_text: Love, Love, LOVE!~!!
Hugged me in all the wrong places: very low cut, waste to tight, hips with too much fabric.

links_reviews_title: TXgiving counts as a party right?!
links_reviews_text: Soooo. Rented the 6, which is accurate for somebody who's a 6. I'm more of an 8, so this was a bit snug and after we took our family Christmas photo, I changed to jeans. But worth the adorable pic !!

links_reviews_title: Perfect fit. Lined and thick material.
links_reviews_text: Such a good cut

Wasn't sure if this would work for non-holiday events, but it was great. Lots of compliments on the unique fabric (the black fringe part specifically). Was a little on the short side but overall a good pick.
So easy to style with a solid place sweater and OTK boots! Wore it for a company holiday party and it was a hit! The black stripes are a softer tinsel texture adding festive feels.
Great for, cut and fabric. Beautiful pop of color. Received compliments all day
Loved this skirt!! The material was a bit itchy but it was super cute for work.
Skirt was very cute and comfortable and versatile.

I was obsessed with this skirt, I literally wanted to wear it everyday, it makes you feel good, looks so cute and is comfy too!!!
