I wore it to my work Christmas dinner and dressed it up with heels and a fitted turtleneck and then wore it a few more times but dressed it down with a tee and flats!! It's super festive and the quality is excellent!!!
Loved this skirt! It was a little snug and I probably would have bought it had I rented the 4... but given I rented the 2, I didn't want to buy it too big!
Loved this skirt. Very festive, it is an itchy material but I wanted to wear leggings under it so it wasn't a big deal. Super fun to wear!

I loved everything about this skirt! I'm glad I sized up, as the fabric has absolutely zero give. I recommend you do the same if you're between sizes. The two horizontal black bands across the middle of the skirt are a tinsel-like material, but I loved them! Got tons of compliments on this one.

links_reviews_title: All the holiday feels with this skirt!
links_reviews_text: LOVED this classic plaid holiday print! The skirt itself was a tweed-like material with black sparkly fabric accents sewn onto it. The skirt was high waisted and tends to ride up, so be careful if you wear to work.

links_reviews_title: PERFECT PLAID! Loved pairing this J.Crew skirt with the matching J.Crew bag!
links_reviews_text: #JCREW #plaid #schoolgirl #uniform #red #black

I rented this for the Scottish parade in NYC and it was the perfect tartan! It has a sparkly embroidery that takes it easily into a fancier event. I was comfortable in this miniskirt - tights are a must!
Great length. Great materials. No complaints at all.
Wore this to a Christmas party and it was beautiful! Loved the colors and the lace details were great. Fit was true to size. Would definitely rent again!
Lots of compliments

Hadn't paid much attention to the decorative shiny black trim on this skirt when I chose it online. When it arrived I was concerned it might be a little too festive for work, but looked great with boots, tights and sweater and revved up an otherwise dull gray winter day at the office

Fit was true to size and not too short or tight so it was work appropriate. I wore it with a black turtleneck, a black waist belt with gold circle buckle to highlight the waist, and grey Stuart weitzman over the knee boots. My accessories were simple- gold round face leather band men's watch, gold stack rings, and small gold ear crawlers that spelled love.

I loved this skirt- perfect for a Christmas outing to the orchestra. I tend to be wider in the hips with a smaller waist. I usually go between a 6 and an 8. The 6 fit great in the waist but was tighter in the hips. I wore the 8 and was very comfortable.
This is the perfect skirt for the holiday season! Not too short so work and church friendly, yet an edge of sassiness for date night!

links_reviews_title: Would be great for a casual holiday party
links_reviews_text: I wore this to work in December, as a festive skirt, but it would be really good for a casual holiday party or gathering. I'd consider it work appropriate, I wore it with black tights and a black top. Hits me about 4" above the knee though so maybe depends on your work. The shiny Lurex part is not too much. I do think it would be kind of weird to wear once you're NOT in the holiday season though.

links_reviews_title: Super cute skirt perfect for the office.
links_reviews_text: I loved this rental. I paired it with black tights and a long sleeve back shirt. The glittery black detail makes it more than a generic plaid skirt but isn't too dressy for a normal day at the office. I have found for my petite frame that J Crew skirts are a fantastic fit. It's true to size.
Super cute; looks a little Christmas-ey. I ended up wearing it to work, and the 0 was a little snug and short, so I wore it with black tights. It would be great for a weekend outfit though.

I was very happy with this skirt. It didn't ride up (which skirts almost always do on me because i take long steps and walk fast), fit perfectly, and was really cute. would be super cute for the holidays too. i wore it with polka dot black tights and another rental, a gray and black jacket

This was soooo cute as a tight fit mini skirt, but it was SO itchy even thru the liner! I had to wear an undershirt so it wouldn't scratch my waist. Would've been great with tights, but without them my thighs itched constantly! I wore it for a concert outing, but I took it off the second I got home. If you don't like tight fits then size up. Otherwise rent true to size! Not too short which was nice. Overall cute but not comfy, so I wouldn't rent again.

links_reviews_title: Easy to wear and super versatile.
links_reviews_text: Slim fit. High Waist. Will hit mid torso if you are shorter. Looks great with bodysuits.
Beautiful skirt true to size
Kept getting compliments.

You can't really tell from the pics on the model but this skirt has these thick shiny black Christmas tinsel things on it. Also I tried it on, and it feel well, but it was itchy for the whole 5 mins it was on me. Because of these reasons it was just a no for me and went straight back. Side note I tried so many times to submit a pic of the tinsel stripes on this but for whatever reason it wouldn't upload. You'll have to trust me on this one.
Thick material so I wish this had been available sooner than April. Good high-waisted skirt and the length was good for work. Looked cute with black tights and boots.
Nice material, rich color, tailored look all contributed to a nice professional look
I was ecstatic when this Black Halo dress came in brand new with tags! Just disappointed that the sleeves were long and bigger. I ended up wearing it still and just rolled up the sleeves.

links_reviews_title: Great work dress! Conservative and figure flattering. Rich color and lovely design.
links_reviews_text: #classic

I rented this for a work conference and loved it. I was nervous about the sleeves on this dress because the sleeves typically are tight on my biceps but this dress fit like a glove. It was a little bit tight on my hips/butt, but even with an hourglass figure it was very comfortable. I typically wear a 4 or 6 and took a gamble with the 4 and won. Only negative was that the sleeves were long so I rolled them under. Thick material and very flattering. Got many compliments!

links_reviews_title: I wish there was more stretch
links_reviews_text: I rented this for work. I liked the color but I didn't love the fit. I wish it had been a tad shorter and had more stretch. However, I was still able to walk easily because the slit in back is pretty high (but not inappropriately so)
Does not run true to size - could not wear it was so tight
Fits snug across hips. Shoulders and arms moved stiffly and caused the front to gap. Should have gone up a size
It was too tight in the bust and then loose in the waist.
Dress fit true to size, and was just tad big on me, but passable to wear. Like the shape and lining. Shoulder area was stretched out from being on a hanger, which was too bad.

links_reviews_title: Arms too big and big snug in the bodice
links_reviews_text: I loved the color and neckline... the arms are too big but the bodice is a bit tight. I am 16 weeks pregnant so I went a size up thank my regular but it was still a big snug

What a lovely dress! The color is deep (as opposed to bright) and gorgeous. It stands out, but doesn't demand attention. The cut is very flattering and work-appropriate. The dress is a perfect stand alone outfit - you don't need a jacket to feel pulled together. It does run small - I went up a size (from a 4 to a 6) and it still looks very tight across my body (I have a big butt, but a flat stomach); on the other hand, the sleeves are comfortable and maybe a little loose on the size up (and I have muscular arms). Also, the collar ridge thing does run right across the left boob. I think it looks nice, but I could see that bothering some people.
Fits great all over, would wear again- lots of compliments. I wear a 6 or 8 and rented in a 8 and felt great.

links_reviews_title: Runs small in the hips- too form fitting to be comfortable for a conservative work environment.
links_reviews_text: True to the picture on the model, this is very form fitting across the hips and backside. My normal size was too body conscious for a conservative workplace
Looked very cute but was definitely a size or more too small.

links_reviews_title: Maybe the Sheath is Just Not for Me
links_reviews_text: I think I've come to the conclusion that my body type was not designed to wear a sheath dress which is a shame because they are all the rage right now! I work for a super-conservative Southern company and I just could not pull off this form-fitting dress. I felt it was too small but likely it was just meant to fit that tightly because it is a sheath. So - will avoid that dress style for future RTR picks and see what happens. Otherwise, loved the color and the weight of the material and the neckline and the length.

links_reviews_title: It runs small and is form fitting
links_reviews_text: It is a pretty color and cut, just too right for work in normal size
I felt a bit like a stewardess, but got lots of compliments
The sleeves were a little long, but overall was a big hit. Wore once to work and to a bat mitzvah service in the late fall.
The fit was not good, tight in the hip area and too big in the bust, also the sleeves were way too wide. Fabric was nice, however I couldn't wear this.

Great fit. Classy work dress. Received lots of compliments. Beautiful color and fabric. I typically wear a 4 but this was a 6. So it must run a little small. I have narrow build so it wasn't tight fitting and was very work appropriate.

links_reviews_title: SO warm and cozy - will definitely rent again
links_reviews_text: I loved this one so much. Very casual and cute. It was really warm and soft. I didn't want to take it off! Fit really well, maybe runs a little big but I think you want it that way. Will definitely be renting again!

links_reviews_title: Great for everyday, a little boxy
links_reviews_text: Wore several times. It's great to throw on with jeans or black pants. It has a boxy square shape
5/5 loved this! So warm and cozy!
A little boxy, very thick and warm

links_reviews_title: A nice classic piece to wear to work or for every day. Nothing earth shattering but a cute basic.
links_reviews_text: This sweater is cozy and fits basically true to size (I'm usually between a small and a medium and the small was the way to go with this).

links_reviews_title: Loved this, it wasnt so heavy that i was dying of a heat stroke, but perfect for chilly
links_reviews_text: fit great, absolutely as described
Beautiful sweater- lots of compliments!
I rented this to lounge around in so I ordered a size up and it was perfect. Wasn't sure that I wanted to send it back.

links_reviews_title: I wore this for my first day of work at a new office.
links_reviews_text: This sweater is longer than I expected, hitting low hip. It was warm and comfortable. I styled it with black skinny jeans and black booties.
Really warm, flattering and loved the plaid pattern.
Soft, comfortable and stylish!
I loved the sweater. It was super soft and not widly baggy like most winter sweaters.

links_reviews_title: Comfortable dress, a little snug around the middle
links_reviews_text: Lots of room in the arms/shoulders, but a little tight in the waist band. Great for pear shapes. Does not gap in the front.

I enjoyed wearing this dress! It was pretty easy to just throw on for a day of work and errands, though not super comfortable in the arms. I initially found it very unflattering in the midsection, but wearing it with tights helped. I was also surprised by how leopard print-y the dress was, but decided to lean into the look by wearing it with a leopard print coat (plus black tights and Chelsea boots). Got some nice compliments on it. Would definitely consider renting again.

links_reviews_title: Cute work to happy hour dress
links_reviews_text: I'm usually an 8, sometimes a 10. This was slightly big in the waist but the 8 would have maybe been too snug in chest and shoulders. Either way, it was cute for a day at the office and good with tights.
The tailoring of this dress is amazing. Has room for a large chest and the waist is fitted. It's a little long on me, but I still liked the look. Looks even better on than it does in the photos.
Definitely order up! An 8 fit like a glove, super cute work dress

links_reviews_title: Lovely dress, size up more than you think
links_reviews_text: It was a great dress, the material was super high quality. However I usually am a 4 and ended up renting a 6 bc it was the only size available. So glad I did because even the 6 was tight - especially in the bust!
Very cute. It fit well but the cuffs were a little tight. I might consider sizing up.

I am always a size 0 and this fit good so I assume runs small Great for high 60s temps No itch Would give it 5 stars but was a tad restrictive not a fan of buttoned wrists - hard to undo without assistance so not good to wear while clothes shopping Great color perfect for fall Can button closed neck or open Side zipper Fully lined Came few inches above knee at 5'6 Would be cute with tights too
Very pretty and sophisticated. Not as hot as it looks. Runs a little bit small but very nicely firm fitting and great length

links_reviews_title: It could be a nice dress for work depending on your body type.
links_reviews_text: I liked the dress online better than in person. It just didn't suit my body type. I have wider shoulders and ribs. It fit too snug in those areas. I went a size up and still felt the dress was too snug.

I wore this dress for a major meeting at my workplace. Boy did this dress make me feel like I was professional, confident, and excited to take on the day. I was getting compliments left and right. The waist runs on the tighter end but it fit me just right!

Was a little loose in the bust for me but not really noticeable. Cuffs are hard to button alone. But lovely and swingy skirt with a fun but subtle print. The fabric was like a lightweight crepe so it didn't wrinkle easily and had great movement and was breathable. Wore it 3 times (two dinners and a board meeting). Considered keeping it because it was so easy and appropriate for so many occasions.

Pros: cute dress that is fitted in the waist and falls nicely. Love the combo of the animal print with the on-trend pleats. Very comfortable to wear. Cons: the gathering of the fabric around the chest/boobs is more of a 1930s style and doesn't give your boobs a natural shape.

links_reviews_title: I like this dress a lot! Can dress down or up and either way looks appropriate for the occasion!
links_reviews_text: I wore this to both a work event & a wedding and got a lot of compliments. The arms/shoulders run really large and the waist is rather tight. I'm usually a size 12 so I'm glad I sized up for my waist, but the shoulders I wish I had sized down twice

I wore this dress four different times for the month I had it and got compliments every time. It's a great day to night dress and the material is top quality. It's a bit heavier so I'd skip it for summer months. But an awesome dress all around!
So cute! Fitted where you want it to be fitted. A little tight at the bust so size up if you're concerned about that

links_reviews_title: The comfort but still felt sexy/cute.
links_reviews_text: Love this dress!! Perfect length and cut for work. Very comfortable, but still felt really cute in the office. The sleeves are a bit tight at the wrists for my taste. Overall great dress. 10/10 would rent again.
Loved the button up look. Great dress for work and I paired it with a pair of high heel boots for a night out. The top can be a bit tight if you have bigger breast
Adore this one!!
Cute dress. Perfect length for work. Fit my waist perfectly. A little tight in the shoulders.
Fit really well, giving room in the bust but tight right under for a polished tailored look. Fun and flirty but nice dark colors. Great for work.
Perfect daytime dress for work. Flattering, comfortable, and adorable pattern.
Sleeves were a little long, and they don't roll up well or stay up when pushed. Other than that, everything fit as expected. Nothing super special but a good rental for a dinner out with family.
I knew from a previous rental that Fame & Partners runs small (I'm usually a 0 or 2) so I rented a 4 and it fit perfect.
This dress fit once on but difficult to get in and out of and very restrictive in arms

Would def rent again. I've been sizing up to 4 for conservative office. This fit well with room to wear fitted long sleeve bodysuit as an extra layer for cold office. Sleeve length was just right plus wrist has buttons which is so fitted watch didn't fit in and out so had to choose in or out. Subtle, fun colors too!
Too long in the arms so I was unable to wear it

This is a really fun work dress. The fabric is not stretchy, though and it is runs tight through the chest right under the breasts. I saw people thought it ran small. I typically wear a 0 or a 2 so I chose the 2. I actually think I could have gone with a 4 and will plan to rent it again in that size.

links_reviews_title: Did not fit bust- too tight.
links_reviews_text: Pretty pattern. Sleeves are tight at wrist and if you're a C or up, you may need to size up.
I received so many compliments on this dress that I rented for a big presentation at work. It fit true to size...a little snug on my 34C bust but very flattering.

links_reviews_title: Very cute, but a little tight in the waist.
links_reviews_text: Great for the office, the sleeves were a little baggier than I expected and the waist a little smaller.
Size up!
Loved the cut of the dress.
I worn this dress to Thanksgiving and received so many compliments. I loved the print and the fit. The buttons around the wrists were a little tight but loved the whole look overall!
This dress was super cute and feminine, but it runs small. My reg size justtt fit.
I loved this dress! Used for work and weekend. Great fit - cute and flattering!
Fits beautifully, very comfortable and stylish. Well made.
Skip this if you're over DDD!
Zips up the side to a perfect fit! The boob area is a little awkward sometimes lol but it worked out... It was a little baggy in the boobs.
Too small around the bust.

Loooooved this blazer. It's the perfect fabric weight, not overly warm but still nice for 60 degree weather. The cut is sleek and long and looks very flattering. It can make any outfit look expensive. I wore it several times, to formal dinners with a dress and out and about with tshirt and jeans. It looks awesome with anything! The shade of white is perfect, not to cool, not to yellow.

A little hesitant renting this because white blazers can have a tendency to turn into white-coat-wannabe-doctor-esque type of a look. This blazer was NOT that - it was chic and nicely lined, and the lapels were the cutest. It's pretty long, especially for shorter women like myself, but make it werk, hunny!

links_reviews_title: Cute large jacket look. Doesn't look high quality though
links_reviews_text: This was fun for a rental bit I was surprised the overall construction, fabric, and tailoring were not a high quality look. Sleeves were far too long but worked for a casual rolled sleeve look.

I am obsessed - I have been waiting to get my hands on this puppy and finally did. I ended up wishing I had a smaller size but is a super easy layering piece for work - goes with everything and is a very relaxed, effortless look while still feeling polished. High recommend.
Chic and easy to wear. Size down if we want a tighter fit.Good material. I'm Size small top 34c
Honestly I felt a little David Byrne (Talking Heads era) but everyone seemed to love it. No way you're gonna get this to fit "close." Embrace the big.
Super trendy, heavy and quality material. Probably best worn as a fall layering option. It ran a little large too, but I think that's the way it's supposed to look!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful blazer (and brand new) but way too big for my frame
links_reviews_text: Too big for petite frames

links_reviews_title: Way too big - I did a size 8. Could have used a size 2 or 4. Maybe will try with a smaller size
links_reviews_text: way too big
This blazer isn't white - it's more of an offwhite/cream. It was easy to throw over things and make a T-shirt and jeans feel chic.
The reviews were right, it's baggie. Too baggie for work, but looked cute for a weekend brunch look.
A comfortable travel tunic - perfect for day to night. The material's elasticity feels nice for an active wrinkle-free day.
This shirt is amazing. Long length . Comfortable to wear. Great material. Has some stretch. I wish I more reasons to keep this!! Will definitely rent again. Medium fit my 5'5 152 34D body just fine!

links_reviews_title: Can be dressed up or down
links_reviews_text: This top surprised me. I was expecting more of a poplin material but it's a stretchy material which took me by surprise. I'm between a M and L in sail to sable and went with the large for a better fit across my hips. This can be dressed up or down for sure. I wore it for a date night with black jeans but could see it worn to a dressier affair as well.
This was much too formal to wear for business casual work environment. It fit great but I didn't have an occasion to wear it.
Not my favorite.....the material is a little stiff and the tunic wasn't as flattering as I thought it would be.

links_reviews_title: Classy tunic for a winter night out
links_reviews_text: Length and fit were nice and fabric thick. Seemed to smell like it had been worn and dry cleaned a million times (probably has) and i wasn't sad to send it back, but it fit the bill for a concert with the girls and worked well for post-partum body

links_reviews_title: I needed a "concert black" shirt and this fit the bill.
links_reviews_text: I was a size 14 and this XL fit well. There's nothing memorable about this shirt, but it's nicely constructed and is a good choice when you want to wear black.
Velvet trim was super fun and added extra snark to this beautiful piece!! Wore with black leggings and suede booties for a sleek look!
Loved everything about this top! Wore it for a long work day.
Enjoyed. It is light weight but not see through.
The top looks a little redder here because of the lighting but it was an adorable top & I wore it to work with no concerns.
My favorite top on RTR! Good for day or night/ work or play. A little shorter in front so it's perfect with high waisted pants!
Would be cute with pants or a skirt. Flowy, great length, not too long or short. Very comfortable and breathable fabric.

This shirt was so perfect. It was easy to dress up or down and went perfectly from day to night. It was a relaxed fit without losing shape. The sleeves were a little short on me but wasn't a problem with the detail in the sleeves. Such a great piece!

links_reviews_title: Cute top for work or weekend
links_reviews_text: I rented this top to wear to a football game, but then I picked something else so I wore it to work instead. I like the colors and pattern and overall it was cute and comfy. It was a little short for me, but high waisted jeans made it work. It's nothing special, but it's a cute top for everyday wear.

I really liked this top! I wore it once to a casual board game night and then to work, and it was just such an effortless, pulled together look. Fabric is very comfortable and print is nice as well. Would've potentially bought if not still so expensive!

links_reviews_title: Had to adjust it all day long
links_reviews_text: This looked good tucked into high waisted jeans and shorts. It was more cropped than I thought it would be. Overall I really liked the shirt, but I did have to keep adjusting it all day because it would slide back over my shoulders constantly.
Nice top, but nothing noteworthy. I sized down at 6 months pregnant and had plenty of room; it's just very cropped. The ruffle sleeves were fun and not too long. No wrinkles all day long.

I picked this top to wear with high waisted jeans this month. It's something that is easy to throw on without much thought. I love the color, pattern, and the sleeves. I have a longer torso so it's shorter but like I said will play nicely with high waisted jeans. I love the sleeve detail.

links_reviews_title: Shorter in front longer in back
links_reviews_text: It was more cropped in the front than I thought it would be, I had wanted to tuck it in but I don't think it would stay. There were also some weird puckers in the fabric even though it was NWT. The fit is flowy so it's TTS

links_reviews_title: transitioned perfectly to a happy hour beer tasting from the office.
links_reviews_text: Perfect for a casual work environment with booties and jeans. Loved extra detail with the flared/belled sleeves.
I did not end up wearing this shirt. It fit a cropped and boxy fit and was unable to wear it.
A little short so I wore with high waisted jeans

links_reviews_title: I got this for everyday wear/work. It is so easy to wear, fits perfectly, and is comfortable.
links_reviews_text: Fits perfect! I am very petite (5'1") and it doesnt hit too long on me like most shirts do. Its shorter in the front and longer in the back. The v kneck isnt too deep and is appropriate for work or everyday wear. Would be great for Valentine's even! You could dress it up to be more sexy or dress it down and wear it more casually for work. Overall, great top!

links_reviews_title: Cute blouse but sleeves are long!
links_reviews_text: Cute blouse - runs a little short. The sleeves were super cute but since the bell sleeves were long, it kept getting in the way during dinner.

links_reviews_title: Date Night, steak house dinner... everything!
links_reviews_text: I LOVED the sleeves on this one...it was a fun little detail. Overall, it ran a bit large but not unwearable. It is also a little shorter so pair with high waisted jeans or a pencil skirt!

links_reviews_title: I bought this to wear as an everyday/work blouse
links_reviews_text: It is a little more cropped than I wanted it to be, but its cute and im glad i rented it!
great top

links_reviews_title: Loved except 2 holes so wore under jacket
links_reviews_text: Fit well but needed to wear under jacket
Super cute work shirt.
Slightly short in torso, but other than that, amazing quality and received a ton of compliments.

I rented this for a concert with my parents + dad's client. So, I needed something fashionable, but also conservative. I paired it with a pair of wooden Seychelles platforms, flare jeans and gold hoops. It is perfect for a petite person. The length was amazing - I could french tuck or leave out. Sleeves fit well.

links_reviews_title: Feminine and chic, perfect for layering and very versatile.
links_reviews_text: I got this to wear for a work event, layered it with a black cami and slacks and it was perfect. It does run small for those with long torsos, but because I layered it with a cami it wasn't an issue. That night, I changed into jeans, took off the cami and it was a great top to wear out. Overall, a super versatile piece that has great details and a very feminine feel.

links_reviews_title: Super cute for work and transitions to evenings well!
links_reviews_text: Great fit; very true to size

I love this shirt. Slightly cropped on me but looks amazing with a high waisted pant. Perfect for fall, it's not too thick or too thin. The color is beautiful too! Feels high fashion with the neck tie option!

I rented this for Fall Family photoshoot, and loved it for this! It was super flattering and fit perfectly. Light material that was soft and nice, and kept me cool in the fall sun. It was really pretty without being overly feminine. However it was short, I tucked it into high waisted jeans in the front, and only like 1" would tuck in. I'm 5'4" and have a short torso so if you have a longer torso, prepare for it to hit above your belly button. Otherwise I really liked it!
This top is practically a crop top, it's so short. I would LOVE it and buy it if it were an inch or two longer, but it's good for a day at work tucked into a skirt or with a pair of skinny pants.
This top is so flattering and perfect for fall. I wore with black skinny jeans and leather booties and I loved the look
They didn't have my usual size so I went up a size. I'd say that this is TTS. I like this casual crop top paired with jeans!
Fit great! Cute with high waisted jeans

links_reviews_title: Cute and casual top for a fun night out, but ultimately nothing special
links_reviews_text: Really cute top for a casual night out, but ultimately nothing super special. The fabric is like thick crepe. It is pretty low cut so you might need to pin it together or size appropriately- I think this would fit better on someone with a little more bust to fill it out. I had to be careful when I bent over. The elastic on the arms was also crazy tight. It wasn’t super uncomfortable but it did leave marks.

Im usually a size 10, but had to go up a size since it wouldn't zip - so glad I was able to try on in store then reorder quickly. Definitely wear a bra with it - the top half can be a bit loose. Doesn't ride up which is great in a crop. Happy with it - but it's a toss up if I would rent again.
This ended up being shorter than I expected, but I still really liked how it fit. A cute top for a night out, but it was a little shorter than I'm comfortable with.

Maybe I have a long waist, but I expected this to cover my belly button. I'm even wearing high-waisted jeans. It's a shame because it's a pretty shirt (and comfortable). So I recommend it for short-waisted people or those with rock hard abs.
I loved this top!! The pale rainbow stripes make it unique and the wrap really cinches in your waist well

links_reviews_title: Once upon a time in Hollywood
links_reviews_text: I wore this cute top to the Tarantino film and felt like I could have stepped right into the screen. Lovely throw back vibes! Draw backs- it is VERY roomy in the front while sitting. If you're not particularly busty you won't have enough to hold everything in place (like I did :c). Also- had to do stickies for bra as the fabric is too loose and thin to go without. Renter beware- this fabric has no stretch and closes with a zipper on one side!

I loved that it wasn't tight. If you're small chested, the room allowed might not look right but for well endowed women it'll look great. I love that the arms are flowy. It's super cropped and while I never show my midriff, I didn't feel super uncomfortable because it wasn't tight on my skin. I wish I could afford to buy this piece! Lots of compliments!

This top was a little short but looked great with high rise denim. I had to double stick tape the neckline a bit to keep it from opening up too much but all in all this blouse was a bit! So trendy and flattering.

This was a cute rental, and form fits well. As a bustier woman, I had to pin the front so I wasn't spilling out of the top. It was the only way to be comfortable walking around the city. Otherwise, it's a comfy top and adds nice color to any outfit!

links_reviews_title: A bit on the sexy side, but a very pretty shape, overall.
links_reviews_text: I don't normally wear cropped tops, so I took a chance with this one. Sleeves are gorgeous, shape is great and thinning; however, my only issue is the same as everyone else: the wrap is a bit too loose, even for a D-cup size (hence why I couldn't give it above a 3-star rating). I wore this to work, so I needed to be on top of the wrap folds to ensure they weren't too revealing. Overall very pretty and paired really well with a pair of jeans and heels.
Can easily be dressed up or down. Love the fit. Considering buying.
I'm not super comfortable with cropped tops. This one fit weird and would be great if I had DD's it hung with under inflated breast area.

links_reviews_title: A cute top for going out
links_reviews_text: The proportions seemed a little off to me. The sleeves were a lot shorter than I expected as was the tip itself. I'm 5'9 and I would say my arms are particularly long but it fit me like a crop top with half sleeves. The cut is pretty low so it showed a little bra which I'm sure would have bothered me more if I wore it out in the day time. It definitely wasn't what I was expecting but a cute top nonetheless and I made it work

links_reviews_title: Much shorter than the picture. I’m 5’7 and it shows my whole stomach and back
links_reviews_text: Great quality, right in arms, very short unlike picture. Was not able to even wear it. It was also super stretched around bottom
I have a shorter torso so this did not fit and I did not wear. Fit around the waists - but the chest was just too bit

links_reviews_title: I have a short torso, but large breast. So, the breast took over and it was true crop
links_reviews_text: Con: Arms are small and not enough room in the front for large breast Pro: Great material Overall: Would get it again, but probably for the spring/summer and will go up a size. Although the size was small for my breast, it zipped up and fit my rip cage and upper waist. I'd recommend that larger breasted women go up a size, but be mindful that it might fit your breast but be loose on the bottom.

links_reviews_title: Versatile top that is easy to dress up or down.
links_reviews_text: High end fabric that retains shape well. I wore a camisole under it.

links_reviews_title: Cute if you are comfortable with crop tops
links_reviews_text: I forgot to get a picture :-( Cute top, definitely a crop top (RTR photo doesn't look it as much). Paired it skinny jeans.
so, so cute! wore out for a date and got a million compliments. fit is perfect. colors and sleeves make it unique. light enough to wear in texas summer :)

I almost did not wear this as it arrived with lipstick (a perfect pout) on the shoulder. But, then I could not tell if that was actually a part of the design or not so I wore it to a short BBQ. My friends confirmed, it was probably not the design and was a stain. Ah well. Would have been a great top to wear and re-wear if it hadn't had the stain.
It's a really cute top, but it capped a LOT, showing off way too much of my boobs
Too baggy around the chest. Would've needed a pin. Otherwise loved the color style and pattern

links_reviews_title: A little short but classy looking!
links_reviews_text: Fit perfectly, a little shorter than I expected. Good with high waisted jeans or pants. Nice fabric. A pin was necessary for me to keep the front from showing too much.

links_reviews_title: This blouse is cut but is very small around the waist area.
links_reviews_text: This blouse goes great with a pair of jeans. It is very small around the waste and was hard for me to wear.
I was expecting this to be on the cropped side but wearable with high waisted jeans and given that I'm petite but it was a full on crop top on me so I didn't wear it.
Cute top however, if you are busty it is more cropped. I wasnt able to fully zipper it over my waist so I recommend going up a size if you have a full bust.
fit great and even though it was a crop top I didn't feel too exposed. You can also wear this with a regular bra which is a plus

links_reviews_title: fun and flirty for summer with high waisted pants
links_reviews_text: The wrap effect v-neck is perfect on this top. I do not have to worry about it coming open and my bra showing. The top is very short and, since I carry my weight in my middle, it fits very snug at the waist which is the only concern I have.

links_reviews_title: I rented this top for day to day wear.
links_reviews_text: The top is very short, it came to just under my bra line. If you want the relaxed fit that you see in the photo, size and up, especially if you have a long torso!
Looks cute when you stand still, but not great moving around. It's a little awkward.
Meh

links_reviews_title: Loved this top. It had just enough coverage but it wasn't stodgy.
links_reviews_text: It is pretty plunging.
Paired this with high top jeans and heals for date night.
I didn't realise that it's a belly free blouse which runs true to its size except for the bust.

links_reviews_title: Really cute top. Wore it for Cinco de Mayo!
links_reviews_text: Low cut but not crazy low.
Nice blouse but it gapes open and is shorter then the photo. I'm disappointed that I couldn't wear it.
Such a cute shirt. I did not wear this as it ran big so it didn't fit right. Super bummed
The material and color is great, but the top is so large you'd have to wear an undershirt and it's more a crop top than a shirt. Unfortunately couldn't wear it.

I absolutely love this sweater, it's hard for me to send back but given how warm it is at home now (I wore for a business trip to Seattle where it was still chilly) I'm not sure I'll wear it much. I didn't find it stuff at all and found the small to be flattering and not tight on the bust. Beautiful color and gold buttons are really lovely. Great to dress up or down.
This is a very nice sweater- pretty green color and a slim but not too tight fit. My only complaint is that the material is very thick and somewhat stiff. Nice overall though! Runs TTS.

links_reviews_title: High quality and comfortable everyday sweater
links_reviews_text: Beautiful dark green color, fit true to size, perfect for work or home. Loved this sweater!
This fit great, I loved the button detail on the shoulder.

links_reviews_title: Loved this classy sweater, gorgeous color and very comfortable!

links_reviews_text: The fabric was comfortable, not itchy, and the color was so rich
Nice color and fit, I accidentally put it on backwards at first because the fit it almost identical on both sides. Would rent again.
Cute cozy sweater. Pairs well with skinny jeans and boots.
Wore this Christmas Day and it was very flattering! It fit perfectly.
Beautiful color and perfect fit! The details on the shoulder take it from an average sweater to a special piece. Nice, cozy, and warm!
This sweater fits TTS and is soft and comfortable. The buttons are a nice detail!

links_reviews_title: Super stylish & comfortable, sleeves a bit long
Perfect versatile rental for the weekend!
links_reviews_text: Loved this jacket! Definitely one of my favorite rentals. I didn't want to send it back! Very versatile, dressed up or down I felt polished and comfortable. Would rent it again in a heartbeat.

links_reviews_title: Surprisingly soft moto jacket with fun zipper details
links_reviews_text: I rented this jacket for a night out in Las Vegas. The material was much softer than I expected which was really nice. I loved the fit and it was the perfect weight for a cool December evening in Vegas. The zippers added a little edge and shine too. I'd definitely rent this jacket again.
So cozy and like a sweatshirt! Lots of zippers though
Loved this light jacket for FL weather. Sleeves were a little long but didn't bother me too much.
Material is cotton tee shirt like. The jacket looks good, but it's not warm enough for actual jacket weather.

links_reviews_title: Like a sweatshirt disguised as a Moto jacket
links_reviews_text: Wasn't really expecting it to be such a soft material. Super comfortable yet stylish. Maybe a few too many big zippers, but whatever.
Loved this jacket so much I bought it! The weight of the jacket makes it very comfortable and it is a fun print that is modern and versatile and it fit me perfectly.

links_reviews_title: This jacket is super cute and comfortable.
links_reviews_text: This jacket fit very well, and it was extremely comfortable.
Liked this one! Noted in other reviews that the sleeves were long - they were perfect for me :) Comfy and cute for everyday use.
The material on this is super-soft and comfortable. It's flattering and stylish enough for a casual office. I'd rent it again!
This is cute but there's a lot of metal making it quite noisy.

links_reviews_title: Super comfortable. Love the gold zipper accents.
links_reviews_text: Very soft and comfortable jacket. Zipper pulls on sleeves clunked around a bit at work, but so worth it style-wise. Can be worn fully zipped for a more formal look.

Loved this vibrant rental -- like sunshine on a winter day. It fit perfectly and I was able to layer it for added warmth without looking too bulky. I received multiple compliments on the color. Considering buying!
This sweater is SUPER bright and very cozy. XS fit great. Paired with black jeans but would be cute in spring/summer with white too!
Such a fun color and a great way to spice the winter blues!
Not scratchy or itchy and super comfy. Love the citron/lemon color and perfect for a bright pop of color during winter. Not cropped but not long enough for leggings.
Adorable and looked super expensive! Loved this one
comfortable and true to size! Got so many compliments
This surprisingly soft sweater was a fun addition to to my week.Received tons of compliments all day!
Sweater fit well...just as pictured! Wasn't warm but I wore it with a heavy jacket for a winter outing to a brewery. Loved the sunny appearance!
A cropped silhouette would have made this more weekend ready and on trend but worked out for a one time wear
I was disappointed because the sweater felt kind of thin. Fun lemon lime color, but I didn't wear.
fit perfectly, warm and super cute!
color is SO fun <3 great for any event

links_reviews_title: I wore it with black leggings and half booties
links_reviews_text: The color was amazing however I felt a little frumpy because the bottom of the sweater was sort of awkward because it looked like the material was out of shape and the sleeves were very long. I ordered a large, I think a medium would have been a little better.
Was super comfortable. The color was a little bright but that's why I liked renting it and not buying it. Good for trying something outside your comfort zone especially since I'm always in black!
Beautiful, fun color. Not too thick & bulky. I received so many compliments!
Comfy sweater - great color and great length
Comfy, nice pattern and color ladies, go for it if you are a cold weather state.
Super cute and comfy. Love wearing a bright color on a dreary NYC day!
Bright and cheery . Looks great with jeans and booties. Atypical color for winter's day– but somehow it works.
Loved this so much I bought it. Love the lemon color. The big turtleneck is really cute and universally flattering.
Very comfortable and great for everyday
Perfect sweater

links_reviews_title: Love the color of this sweater!
links_reviews_text: The color is really fun and bright. The turtle neck part is very thick. Didn't realize how warm of a sweater it is! But it's comfy for a cold day!
Thought this sweater appeared yellow in the picture but it much more of a line green color. Would have worn if the color was yellow. Besides that very cute.

I loved these. Originally I had the 4, but then sized up next time to the 6. Preferred the 4, but it did pull at my hips a little. Hard to say which size is better!! But if you have an hourglass shape, these will be hard to fit just right.

I love these pants! It's an easy fit because the side buckles let you adjust to the perfect amount of waist hug. The length is trendy and the material is semi-thick so a good choice for spring, before it gets too hot.

links_reviews_title: Cutest pants; wish I'd kept them!
links_reviews_text: Really flattering sporty look for the office. Paired these with a duster vest and sneakers

Wanted to love these. Ordered a size down (I'm normally a 2) and by the end of the day still a lot of stretch. The straps on side were super cute but clasp was flimsy and they'd come undone-- so they didn't provide the tighter cinched look I was hoping for. If you are smaller than a 2 than I don't think these would work.

links_reviews_title: Comfortable and chic - oversized fit with space through hips and thighs
links_reviews_text: These pants are very comfortable. They run large and I had plenty of space at the waist even with a sweater tucked in. I have a small waist compared to larger thighs/hips and the cut of these left plenty of room through the leg. I wore them with Margaux flats and a sweater to work but I also wore them with sneakers and a tee on the weekend
I would've bought if I had the next size down.
Love these pants! Comfortable and perfect for everyday wear. I found they ran true to size and you can adjust the waist as well which is great. Will rent again.
These fit great! Well made. Great for work. Adjustable buckle closure on hips makes the fit easy to adjust. Wish I could buy them but a little too much for me.

Overall these were very stylish but for me they fell a little tight. The back pockets also flared out a bit which made the look a little odd. Didn't end up wearing them as they were just a little too tight but loved the look.

Perfect fit. Slightly loose (which is meant to be) and I like that the waist is adjustable because I have a pear shaped body and most pants in my size are 2-3 inches large in the waist. I'm taking off one star because although the waist is adjustable, the belt buckle prong moves. The prong needs to be longer in order to stay in the correct position.

links_reviews_title: Great work pants - considering buying them!
links_reviews_text: I love how these fit - a bit roomy, but look professional. Perfect with a turtleneck or a sweater. Very comfortable and great with some white sneakers.

Wore them once with a gray-ish sweater, and once with a fitted tan shirt. Look cute with sneakers or flats. They were slightly big, so my only issue is that there are buckles at the waist and they kept coming undone for me. I ended up safety pinning them shut from the inside of the waistband.

Pants fit true to size - maybe a touch large. I'm generally a 6/8 in pants. I went with the six and they fit comfortably. Weight is lovely - these are easily multi-season pants. I'm 5'9" and the length was perfect on me, but I can see them hitting in an odd spot on shorter ladies.

links_reviews_title: Comfy and sleek for work and play
links_reviews_text: It was so great to find a pair of pants that are sleek and professional for work but so comfortable that I didn't want to jump out of them when I got home at night. They ran a little big but were totally slimming so I didn't mind the extra room.
Very trendy and comfortable. I had a hard time styling this for work without repeating the exact same outfit.

links_reviews_title: High rise cropped fit was excellent
links_reviews_text: Pants for me are all about the fit. Between the cut and the fabric of these pants, the fit was just amazing. The high waist and slight cropped length made these more current than other slacks. I thought they were as flattering as they were comfortable. Because of the thin white check they were easy to match with light colors and dark. I even wore them with black (gasp!?) and it kinda worked. The wool fabric is not for hot weather, but it was perfect for fall (45-75 degrees here).
Perfect length for my legs. The pants are a bit loose but the belt made them work perfectly!
This just didn't work on my short legs and body type.
Loved these pants — easy to dress up or down

links_reviews_title: Loved them so much I ordered myself a pair
links_reviews_text: Rented for work but ended up wearing them on weekend as well - comfortable but put together, loose fit without being baggy. Loved!
I'm usually a size 4, but these ran 6-8 on me
I loved these. Dressed up and effortless and so comfortable. Will definitely rent again! Maybe ran a tiny bit large.

links_reviews_title: Comfy pants to wear around the house
links_reviews_text: These adidas Danielle Cathari Firebird Black Pants were super comfortable, but were rather unmemorable and unflattering. I wore these around the house and for running errands and the pants were good for that purpose. The material of the pants was quite thick, which made them a bit warm. They fit true to size, though it was definitely a looser fit.

links_reviews_title: Wore these for a dance workshop and they are great!
links_reviews_text: Thick material and run kinda large. I’m 5’4 and usually wear a 4-6 in pants and could’ve fit small better

links_reviews_title: Great for running around and warmth when headed to gym
links_reviews_text: Very long and a little big

links_reviews_title: Comfy & cute, but see through & wrinkle prone
links_reviews_text: I liked this a lot. Fit as expected. Beautiful buttons. Only downsides were that it's pretty see-through and wrinkles easily
Runs large - I'm normally a 6 but got the 4 and it fit perfectly.
Can be tightened enough in back so it has shape. Cute for knocking around and casual dinners.

links_reviews_title: Super comfy and stylish Jumpsuit. This by far is my favorite rental ever.
links_reviews_text: This jumpsuit runs a little large. I ordered a 14R, it was very loose but I didn't mind as I like my jumpsuits loose. Also the straps in the back helped to frame it better around my body, so that it didn't sag and looked more fitted. Overall I loved the linen fabric, the button detail was beautiful. I received a lot of compliments on this jumpsuit. It is my favorite piece yet from RTR. Will definitely be renting again.

Cute and casual... easy everyday wear. It wrinkles easily, but in person does not show as much as photos. Has a tie in the back to cinch the waist but this was troublesome when undoing all the buttons and back tie when going to the bathroom. All in all just ok... didn't feel amazing in it.

links_reviews_title: Took this on vacation and wore it 3-4 times!
links_reviews_text: I wore this on multiple occasions during vacation- on a day of exploring, for a beach party, and to a dinner out. Pros: It's a super versatile piece and packs easily. Felt comfortable and casual but not out of place at the party. Pretty easy to get off and on to pee! Washed and ironed easily. The buttons were my favorite part. Cons: leg length was very long on me, I had to pin the length up for every wear except with ~3" heels. It is linen, so don't expect a perfectly crisp piece, it's best for casual events. The chest was large and low, I was super conscious when dancing that it gaped open a good amount.
Super cute! I felt like a million bucks, and got tons of compliments.

I really liked this jumpsuit and as someone with a lot of curves I usually always size up for jumpsuits because of my hips but I definitely should have sized down for this jumpsuit as the Material was very baggy and made me look much larger. Still comfortable!

links_reviews_title: I see what others are saying is true
links_reviews_text: Yes, it's boxy and loose and for me that wasn't the issue. The drawstring waist is weird because if you want to use it to add definition to your waist the ties being in the back prove a challenge. I wore to work so not only do you have the stress of basically undressing to use the bathroom but add in that you have to Houdini yourself to untie then retie the drawstring. Not practical for most women In my opinion. Furthermore, one of the buttons fell off as I waited for the bus on my way home. This item was a disappointment, I won't rent again.
Cute

links_reviews_title: Wore this for a date night and again for some meetings.
links_reviews_text: I read the other reviews and decided to go 2 sizes smaller, which turned out to be the right call. It was kind of difficult to shimmy in and out of since it was actually the right size for me (that's just a structural flaw), so I wouldn't recommend wearing it on a night out. It's also very long, so I had to roll up the legs, and I'd say I'm a decent height. Lastly, no one mentioned it but this thing is SHEER. Pair it with some nude Jockey Skimmies and wear the right bra. It also wrinkles easily, but I think that's just the look with linen.
Fit was off for my body type (hourglass)

It runs oversized so I'm going to try one size down to see if the waist tie will make it a little more fitted. Other than that it's awesome! I've gotten tons of compliments on it and will probably end up buying it.
Didn't wear because I looks like a painting uniform. It was HUGE on me and the crotch sat very low. It's also linen so you can see through it.
Beautiful jumpsuit with the most amazing buttons, but was very loose on me.
Flowy. Fabulous.
Loved this but next time will get a smaller size.
I felt like I was going to paint something. Not a good fit for me
It definitely runs large but then I guess that's what makes it comfortable. It is more casual than I expected as well. If you are looking for a comfy vacation or beach jumpsuit, this is it.

links_reviews_title: Not for girls with long legs
links_reviews_text: I am 5'9" and this looked ridiculous on me. It was like highwaters. I couldn't wear it. It is loose fitting and extremely sheer. The cut is awkward and not flattering. Maybe on someone shorter?
Large fit but great for my big boobs
It's a little big and you see it most in the bust (at least with me!) but it was comfortable and easy to wear and I felt very cute in it!
The buttons are so cute but you must go down sizes. My boyfriend said I looked like a painter. The top part was so cute but the bottom part was far too large.

links_reviews_title: Love this jumpsuit! I've rented it twice.
links_reviews_text: Ties at the waist. Roomy in the chest and hips in a good way.
Loved this but was unable to wear it. It runs large and long! 8R was the suggested size to order for this, but I think I would have needed a 4 petite in order to wear it.

links_reviews_title: Size down, but super comfortable and cute!
links_reviews_text: Missing top button.
Loved this jumpsuit. Wore all day and to dinner. Perfect for a cool, laid-back summer look. Especially cute with some statement earrings.
I love this but it was so long that I didn't have heels high enough. I tried rolling it up and it fell down. Unfortunately I was unable to wear this due to the length.

links_reviews_title: Great for tall people, had to wear heels
links_reviews_text: Even though it was long on me, I loved this look. Lots of compliments. A smaller size would have been too small up top. I wore with a clog heel and it was fine. Very hard to get out of when using the bathroom!

links_reviews_title: I loved this and received a lot of compliments.
links_reviews_text: Perfect fit and so comfortable. Of course with any jumper the only issue is how many times you have to go to the bathroom.

links_reviews_title: Concert near a bathroom. Important to know because you will need to remove entire outfit :)
links_reviews_text: Must have curves otherwise not flattering - great fit for my top I am a double DD

Really hard to get on and off, rather wrinkly by end of day, but I just thought it was great. Someone said: "that jumpsuit is so great because it seems so easy to wear, but you look so put together!" Amazing in the heat today. I have never gotten jumpsuits to work because of my long torso. This was flattering and fantastic.

links_reviews_title: I read the reviews, so sized down to a 4, but the chest are was way too big
links_reviews_text: I'm a 32 D, 5'4" and the chest area looked ridiculous on me, too big with too much fabric. I wouldn't be able to go any smaller because the body length was just barely long enough to fit. Returned it immediately. Too bad because the fabric and concept was really cute.
Has the potential to be cute but is so baggy - especially on top. Not even pins or tape could help. Sad I didn't get to wear this one. Size way down!

links_reviews_title: Very comfy, but easily wrinkled. Made me look huge on it.
links_reviews_text: Comfortable, but very big
the fit was much too large - the drawstring couldn't make up for that. also the crotch was much too low. Overall the sizing and proportions were way off
Size down. Fit is amazing and flattering in all the right places.

links_reviews_title: Cute but runs very large. Order one size down.
links_reviews_text: Must be worn with heels as the pant is long.

links_reviews_title: It was way too big, really pretty but I couldn't wear it.
links_reviews_text: The fit was very large but it was very pretty, I just could not wear it.

links_reviews_title: So comfortable and a classy statement piece
links_reviews_text: Although it ran a bit big, the cinching detail at the back allowed me to adjust to whatever fit i wanted. Was so comfortable, quality fabric and buttons and i got a MILLION compliments. Would definitely rent this again.

I love the style and color of this pretty spring shirt. The one I got was brand new which made it ever sweeter. The only issue was that it pulled in my chest. I was recommended to get an L which is my normal size but I probably needed an XL. So if you are larger on top I would size up.
The sleeves run a bit short, but the body is super wide.

I love this and I'm so tempted to keep it in a smaller size. It's super comfortable but definitely size down. The XL was the only one available- I would rent again in the L or even M. I got a ton of compliments every time I wore it!

I kept this jacket for far too long but for good reason. I broke my elbow and was stuck in a splint that went from my shoulder to my wrist for 12 weeks. The first 4 weeks were spent with this jacket as a staple of my wardrobe. This jacket was perfect for draping over the arm with the splint and wearing normally on the other side. It was also but enough to fit my arm with my splint on if I needed to button it up for warmth. TBH I'm very thankful for this jacket. It made those few weeks bearable

I absolutely love this jacket! I wore it multiple times while I had it and almost went ahead and bought it. It is an oversized fit and the sleeves are long! Very comfortable and easy to throw on with an outfit. Would definitely recommend!

Unfortunately, the jacket definitely runs a whole size large, so I was not able to fall in love with the way it looked on my body. As you can see from the picture, it definitely has an oversized fit to it with the drop shoulders and wider frame of the denim. I put it on a few times with the intention of making it work with my outfit but just could not figure it out so I didn't end up wearing it at all.
Great oversized addition to an activewear outfit!
This was a heavy stiff denim And very bulky. Looked awful on me. Returned next day. Bummed. Looked soooo cute
No pockets so I couldn't stick my hands anywhere when I was out. Big up top but fit just wright when I buttoned the bottom two to three buttons. Runs big

I wore this jacket easily 3-4 times a week during the entire month I had it. It is amazingly comfortable! The sleeves are a sweatshirt material which made it so comfy while the rest of the jacket is denim so it was stylish. I wore this jacket with leggings, joggers, and shorts as a casual, everyday look to class and also dressed it up more with an athletic skirt and black jeans one day. Even my roommates loved this jacket and wore it on days when I didn't. I rented a size medium and it was for sure an over sized fit. I will 100% rent again but in a size small. Such a great rental!!!!
Definitely a casual jacket that looks adorable running around town. Size down. It's oversized to begin with but has a lot of extra volume.

links_reviews_title: This jacket was nice and loose so I could wear it over hoodies. Really comfy!
links_reviews_text: A comfortable size if you like looser jackets! Arms were perfect length, not too short.

I loved this jacket! Wore it a ton. Finally decided to swap it out, but if it's available I will rent again. Looked great with the Monroe grey and black tiger strip sweats as well as with black leggings. It is big, I probably could have worn the small, but it's supposed to be boxy and big. It's really cozy and the perfect go to for fall weekends.

links_reviews_title: I got compliments on this jacket almost every time I wore it.
links_reviews_text: quality materials and construction overall.

I rented this because I wanted to try out the style and get something I usually don't wear. It was very well made and kept me warm. I got a large, which is bigger than my normal size, because I thought I'd need more room for big sweaters. I was wrong. It's already a larger fit so definitely keep to your true size.

links_reviews_title: Cute, comfy jacket. Great for an Athleisure wear
links_reviews_text: Great for daily attire especially if you are getting tired of the basic jean jacket look.

links_reviews_title: Warm, deep pockets, just an overall great jacket
links_reviews_text: Wore this for a Air Force Academy football game (way up in the mountains of Colorado). It was perfect for this, even when it rained. If I didn't live in FL, I'd own this
